description:
Several vendors (Orion, Epic, etc.) as well as some participant testers (DoD) have been receiving errors when testing based on Healtheway manual checklists.  These errors haven't been identified in previous participant testing but are showing up with more frequency since product testing has been opened up to the community.  

This ticket is to track work that has come to the product Team's attention through forums, email requests or Healtheway.  Most of these issues identified to this point are around namespaces and messages semantics.  

The are several currents questions:
- (PD, QD, RD)
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema
 
- (PD)
http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/
http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-secureconversation/200512

- (PD)
Expected but did not find any text in node
 
/Envelope/Header/ReplyTo/@mustUnderstand
 
FOUND:
 
<Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:ihe:iti:2007:CrossGatewayQuery</Action>

- (Semantics)
For example: 
Expected: <semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.addr</semanticsText>
Found: <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>

This is a snippet of our request to CONNECT: 
<ns2:parameterList nullFlavor="">
        <ns2:livingSubjectAdministrativeGender nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value code="M" nullFlavor=""/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.administrativeGender</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectAdministrativeGender>
        <ns2:livingSubjectBirthTime nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" value="20080531"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.birthTime</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectBirthTime>
        <ns2:livingSubjectId nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value extension="84568-4562" nullFlavor="" root="251.251.251"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.id</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectId>
        <ns2:livingSubjectName nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <ns2:given partType="GIV" qualifier="">Scott</ns2:given>
                        <ns2:family partType="FAM" qualifier="">Daniel</ns2:family>
                </ns2:value>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">LivingSubject.name</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:livingSubjectName>
        <ns2:patientAddress nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <ns2:streetAddressLine partType="SAL">106 Unicorn Lane</ns2:streetAddressLine>
                        <ns2:streetAddressLine partType="SAL">Rainbow</ns2:streetAddressLine>
                </ns2:value>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.addr</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:patientAddress>
        <ns2:patientTelecom nullFlavor="">
                <ns2:value nullFlavor="" use="" value="tel:(09) 777-2222"/>
                <ns2:semanticsText nullFlavor="">Patient.telecom</ns2:semanticsText>
        </ns2:patientTelecom>
</ns2:parameterList>

This is a snippet of our request from CONNECT to the external gateway: 
<parameterList nullFlavor="">
        <livingSubjectAdministrativeGender nullFlavor="">
                <value code="M" nullFlavor=""/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectAdministrativeGender>
        <livingSubjectBirthTime nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" value="20080531"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectBirthTime>
        <livingSubjectId nullFlavor="">
                <value extension="84568-4562" nullFlavor="" root="251.251.251"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectId>
        <livingSubjectName nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <given partType="GIV" qualifier="">Scott</given>
                        <family partType="FAM" qualifier="">Daniel</family>
                </value>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </livingSubjectName>
        <patientAddress nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="">
                        <streetAddressLine partType="SAL">106 Unicorn Lane</streetAddressLine>
                        <streetAddressLine partType="SAL">Rainbow</streetAddressLine>
                </value>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </patientAddress>
        <patientTelecom nullFlavor="">
                <value nullFlavor="" use="" value="tel:(09) 777-2222"/>
                <semanticsText nullFlavor=""/>
        </patientTelecom>
</parameterList>

CC: 
- Research issues and support meetings with Healtheway/ Vendor
- Create any tickets needed for required modifications to CONNECT
title: Support and Research Heatheway Product Certifications Issues

description:
The changes related to CONN-875 were not complete, and have introduced a bug.  CONNECT 4.3 is emitting the following for both Role and PurposeOfUse elements in SAML assertion.

<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="106328005" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" displayName="Social worker" xsi:type="CE" />


<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" code="COVERAGE" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" displayName="Disclosures for insurance or disability coverage determination" xsi:type="CE" />

Because the H7 namespace on the element is scoped and not the default namespec, the xsi:type value MUST also be namespace scoped to hl7.

The xsi:type value should be
xsi:type="hl7:CE"

CC:
Dev : Ensure that the Role and PurposeOfUse has the following values
<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="106328005" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" hl7:codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" hl7:displayName="Social worker" xsi:type=" hl7:CE" />
<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" hl7:code="COVERAGE" hl7:codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" hl7:codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" hl7:displayName="Disclosures for insurance or disability coverage determination" xsi:type="hl7:CE" />
QA - Run validation suite to ensure the tags are appropriately populated using the server logs.
Run the regression test case related to PurposeOf/For Use.
title: PurposeofUse and Role xsi:type attributes are NOT scoped correctly

description:
The AdminGUI Improvements Wiki page (https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FCPT/Admin+GUI+Improvements) lists a number of fixes that would improve the content, functionality, and usability of the Gateway Administrative Console.

These are fixes related to the Account Management screens. In reference to the Wiki, they are:
* Function item #7
* Visual Defects #10 and #11

CC:
* The "Manage Roles" page replaces the currently existing "Certificate Management" tab under the Account Management section (so that the two tabs are "User Accounts" and "Manage Roles").
* On the "User Accounts" page, the Reset and the Create User buttons have space between them, instead of touching each other. 
* On the "User Accounts" page, the main content area will not have too much space on the sides -- ex., the left side of the "Create User" content box should line up with the highlighted "User Accounts" tab.

NOTE:
Also including the following tweaks --
* Table rows currently have an alternating light-dark pattern, and when the mouse hovers over a table row, it highlights with the dark color.  This highlight has been adjusted so that it is darker than the current dark rows, making it more useful from a visual standpoint.
* On the "User Accounts" page, the Reset and Create User buttons have been restyled to be consistent with other buttons in AdminGUI.
title: AdminGUI Improvements to Address Account Management UI Issues

description:
The AdminGUI Improvements Wiki page (https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FCPT/Admin+GUI+Improvements) lists a number of fixes that would improve the content, functionality, and usability of the Gateway Administrative Console.

These are miscellaneous fixes. In reference to the Wiki, they are:
* Content item #3
* Function items #12 and #14
* Visual Defects #7 and #9

CC:
* Connect Logo appears on Login page.
* Utility nav bar at the top shows a full height (instead of short) border line at the leftmost side -- might have to zoom in to see it.
* Buttons on Gateway Dashboard line up properly.
* In Internet Explorer 8, some text objects on the pages should adjust in size depending on browser window size.

SPECIAL NOTE:
Function item #12 (in the Wiki) is being addressed from a front-end perspective via <meta> tags in the XHTML.  However, the more recommended method is via back-end code by modifying the HTTP headers, as discussed here:  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/49547/making-sure-a-web-page-is-not-cached-across-all-browsers.

CAVEAT:  There are no guarantees that the <meta> tag methods will work (since they cannot control caching done by proxy servers); unfortunately, the recommended method (via back-end code) is not within the scope of this ticket.
title: AdminGUI Improvements to Fix Misc Defects and Add Branding

description:
DoD reached out to the CONNECT team with the following issue they are seeing as they were testing 4.3 with the DIL

We recently did some informal testing of CONNECT 4.3 against the HealtheWay DIL for 2011 specifications. The outbound smoke tests are failing on the DIL because the subject name format and value in the SAML assertion are not following the NwHIN 3.0 specifications. Below is a comparison of the subject name sent from CONNECT 4.3 vs. the DIL. 
 
Did you make a change in CONNECT 4.3 to use NameID vs. Issuer? 
 
Have you tested CONNECT 4.3 against the DIL? 
 
CONNECT subject name
<saml2:NameID Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:X509SubjectName">C=US, O=AEGISnetInc, CN=vlerconformance.mantech.com</saml2:NameID>
 
DIL Subject Name
<saml2:Issuer Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:X509SubjectName">C=US,O=AEGISnetInc,CN=dilhn003.dil.aegis.net</saml2:Issuer
 
CC:
Investigate issue
title: Support DoD and investigate issue related to SAML Issuer

description:
See CONN-691 for some background. THere are two assertion elements in question here Issuer and the Subject/NameID.  In CONN-691 only the Subject/NameID in the SAML header was fixed to behave as follows -  If a subject name is passed into the gateway on the entity interface(Asertion/userInfo/userName), we should continue to honor that value. If no subject name exists we should parse the distinguished name from the client certificate. 
However the Issuer element under SAML assertion does not utilze the same behavior in that if the entity interface element Assertion/samlIssuer/Issuer does not exist or does not have a value, it still displays the default SamlUser value and not the distinguished name from the certificate

CC:
 If a issuer name is passed into the gateway on the entity interface(Asertion/samlIssuer/issuer), we should continue to honor that value. If no issuer name exists we should parse the distinguished name from the client certificate. 
These changes require a unit test and regression test (you can check for the expected value in an adapter mock service).
title: Default SAML Issuer value being used in all SOAP Header Security sections even though a valid X509SubjectName is defined in the private SSL certificate

description:
We need to merge Direct into CONNECT.  Here is the overview of how this can be done per our processes:

Part 1 - Initial merge:

1. Checkout the Direct branch and pull the latest code.
2. Do a git pull, or a git fetch / git merge, from CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT.
3. Resolve all merge conflicts.
4. Verify that the default build succeeds (from the top level, to ensure ValidationSuite passes): mvn clean install
5. Push changes to your remote.
6. Open a pull request against CONNECT-Solution:Direct.

Part 2 - After CONN-1190 and CONN-1212:

1. Checkout the CONNECT branch and pull the latest code.
2. Checkout the Direct branch and pull the latest code.
3. Rebase Direct onto CONNECT (from the Direct branch: "git rebase CONNECT").
4. Resolve all merge conflicts.
5. Verify that full build succeeds (from the top level, to ensure ValidationSuite passes): mvn clean install -P AD,PD,DQ,DR,DS,Direct,AdminGUI,jboss7,was,wasce,weblogic
6. Verify that you can deploy the build to standalone Glassfish (with the pollers enabled), and test both sending and receiving a Direct message.
7. Push changes to your remote.
8. Open a pull request against CONNECT-Solution:Direct.

Part 3 - After successful merge build (Jenkins) from Part 1 and Part 2:

1. Open a pull request from CONNECT-Solution:Direct to CONNECT-Solution:CONNECT_integration.

CC:

- The Direct feature branch has been merged into the CONNECT main branch.

QA:

- Pull the latest code from the main (CONNECT) branch and build with all profiles; validate that the build finishes without issues and ValidationSuite runs successfully.
title: Merge Direct Feature Branch Onto CONNECT Main Branch

description:
We need the CONNECT ear, built with CONNECTDirectConfig, to deploy to Weblogic 12c without affecting the other app server deployments.  Currently, we receive the following exception on deploy:

<BEA-149078> weblogic.application.ModuleException: [HTTP:101216]Servlet: "CXFServlet" failed to preload on startup in Web application: "/CONNECTDirectConfig".
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/applicationContext.xml]; nested exception is java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.xml.XmlBeanDefinitionReader.doLoadBeanDefinitions(XmlBeanDefinitionReader.java:412)
		...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.ClassBeanInfoImpl.checkOverrideProperties(ClassBeanInfoImpl.java:205)
        at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.ClassBeanInfoImpl.<init>(ClassBeanInfoImpl.java:186)
        at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.JAXBContextImpl.getOrCreate(JAXBContextImpl.java:509)

CC:

- CONNECT ear, built with Direct profile, can deploy to and is functional on Weblogic 12c.
- CONNECT ear, build with Direct profile, is still functional on other app servers (Glassfish 3.1.2.2, JBoss 7.1.1, WAS 8.5).

QA:

- Build CONNECT ear with profiles:  Direct,jboss7,was,weblogic.
- Deploy ear to Weblogic 12c and test all SOAP calls via CONNECTDirectConfig SoapUI project.
- Deploy ear to Glassfish, Websphere, and JBoss; run the "addSetting" test case against each deployment and verify that the information persisted to the database.
title: Fix CONNECTDirectConfig Deployment Issues on Weblogic 12c

description:
There is a Camel route defined in CONNECTDirectConfig's applicationContext.xml for auto-refreshing TrustBundles on a timer.  While this route works as expected on Glassfish, JBoss 7 tries to kick off the refresh during deploy, before the SessionFactory is ready.  This causes CONNECTDirectConfig to never initialize.

We need a way to refresh TrustBundles regularly based on their specified refresh interval.

CC:

- Trust Bundles run through the refresh route according to their refresh interval; the solution must not use Camel due to a conflict with Weblogic 12c.

QA:

Pick one of the two following test sets:

SET ONE:

- Set the refresh interval for a TrustBundle to 1 hour, and also set the bundle URL to the "bluebutton-providers-test" (below); verify that it attempts (and succeeds) auto-refresh in the next hour.  At the time of writing this ticket, there are 154 anchors associated to this trust bundle.
- When the first step passes, set the bundle URL to the "bluebutton-patients-test" (below); verify that it attempts (and succeeds) auto-refresh an hour from the last attempt.  At the time of writing this ticket, there are 109 anchors associated to this trust bundle.
- When the second step passes, change the refresh interval to 2 hours; verify that the next refresh attempt is two hours from the previous attempt.

SET TWO:

- Set the refresh interval for a TrustBundle to 1 hour, and also set the bundle URL to an invalid URL; verify that it attempts (and fails) auto-refresh in the next hour.
- When the first step passes (or rather, fails as expected), set the bundle URL to a valid URL; verify that it attempts (and succeeds) auto-refresh an hour from the last failed attempt.
- When the second step passes, change the refresh interval to 2 hours; verify that the next refresh attempt is two hours from the previous attempt.

Note:  Since these cases will kick off automatically, you can leave them for the day / overnight, and just check the logs after the fact.

bluebutton-providers-test: https://secure.bluebuttontrust.org/p7b.ashx?id=cb300117-3a4a-e211-8bc3-78e3b5114607
bluebutton-patients-test: https://secure.bluebuttontrust.org/p7b.ashx?id=4d9daaf9-384a-e211-8bc3-78e3b5114607
title: Allow for auto-refresh of TrustBundles

description:
Currently CN name checking is disabled in CONNECT.
Provide the option to make it configurable.

THis was brought up at the spec factory call on 6/12, there is no normative spec one way or the other, but there are some federal agencies whose certificates are not resolvable by DNS lookups and hence in that case it makese sense that the CN name checking is disabled at run time.

There is discussion on whether the eHealth Exchange wants the Domain names on the certificate should be resolvable. If that is the case, then CONNECT would need to provide the abillity to do the CN name checks.

Next steps on spec factory is to gather requirements from ATNA and other recommendations from STIG/FIPS and further discuss on the spec forums
title: Provide configuration parameter to enable CN name checking in CONNECT

description:
Tiani is the EMR vendor supporting INHS and are failing smoke tests when communicating with the DIL using CONNECT 3.3.1.3, and they think the issue is with CONNECT not validating their TImestamp signature appropriately.

Attached is the sample request and response messages from Tiani/INHS.

description:
The current code value for PurposeOfUse tag in the Validation Suite - Document Submission is "PUBLICHEALTHKIERAN" which is not accepted at NIST. NIST has provided the following codes accepted at their end:
TREATMENT, PAYMENT, OPERATIONS, SYSADMIN, FRAUD PSYCHOTHERAPY, TRAINING, LEGAL, MARKETING, DIRECTORY, FAMILY, PRESENT, EMERGENCY, DISASTER, PUBLICHEALTH, ABUSE, OVERSIGHT, JUDICIAL, LAW, DECEASED, DONATION, RESEARCH, THREAT, GOVERNMENT, WORKERSCOMP, COVERAGE, REQUEST

We need to replace the value "PUBLICHEALTHKIERAN" with on of the values from above list.

The following test cases are using "PUBLICHEALTHKIERAM" as the purposeOfUse code:
Test Suites: g0/g1
Test Cases: Document Submission Deferred Req/Resp, Document Submission, Patient Discovery Deferred Req/Resp, Patient Discovery.

It is better we change this in the Document Submission test script in both g0/g1.

CC: Validatiion Suite should be tested in both standard and passthru modes in glassfish.
       The message should be sent from SUT to NIST.
title: Change PurposeOfUse code value in Validation Suite - Document Submission test case

- Make any necessary code / configuration changes and test against standalone GlassFish, embedded GlassFish, JBoss 7, WebSphere 8, and WebLogic 12c.

If the transition from application server to Spring for transaction management is non-trivial:
- Research and create a design approach.  Present this information during a brownbag session so the team can analyze and discuss.

QA:

- If a brownbag session is held, verify that all notes are documented on the wiki.

description:
During the Direct Connect-A-Thon on May 22, 2014, we discovered that for one HISP, any message inbound to us has the following behavior:

- We send an MDN processed, and the HISP receives this MDN
- The message never appears in our Inbox
- No MDN dispatched is generated

We should investigate whether this behavior is an issue within CONNECT.

Of note, outbound messages to this HISP are received by them successfully, and we receive both expected MDNs in turn.

The information for the HISP that we could not communicate with, as well as the entire event's logs, are available in the ConnectShare under "Direct Connect-A-Thon".

CC:

- Identified whether or not the issue is caused by our Direct instance.
- If this is an issue within CONNECT, opened a ticket to resolve the issue (if this is a trivial fix, fix is as part of this ticket and mention this in the resolution).

QA:

- If the issue is not on our end, just review the resolution details.
- If the issue is ours and a ticket was created, review the new ticket.
- If the issue is ours and was resolved in this ticket, verify that we can still communicate with Direct Transport test tool; if feasible and appropriate, also test receiving a message from the HISP whose messages were previously not arriving in our Inbox.
title: Direct Interop: Investigate Missing Inbound Messages

description:
During the Direct Connect-A-Thon on May 22, 2014, we discovered that two HISPs were unable to exchange messages with us due to a "Content-Type Mismatch" error.  We need to determine whether or not the problem is coming from our end.

The list of HISPs that we could not communicate with, as well as the entire event's logs, are available in the ConnectShare under "Direct Connect-A-Thon".

CC:

- Identified whether or not the issue is caused by our Direct instance.
- If this is an issue within CONNECT, opened a ticket to resolve the issue (if this is a trivial fix, fix is as part of this ticket and mention this in the resolution).

QA:

- If the issue is not on our end, just review the resolution details.
- If the issue is ours and a ticket was created, review the new ticket.
- If the issue is ours and was resolved in this ticket, verify that we can still communicate with Direct Transport test tool; if feasible and appropriate, also test against one of the two HISPs that originally received the "Content-Type Mismatch" error.
title: Direct Interop: Investigate "Content-Type Mismatch"

description:
During the Direct Connect-A-Thon on May 22, 2014, we discovered that four HISPs were unable to exchange messages with us due to a missing Subject Alternative Name for our direct.connectopensource.org certificate.

While this is not an issue with the CONNECT product, we should review the latest Applicability Statement for Secure Health Transport and generate a spec-compliant certificate.

CC:

- Generated a new certificate in compliance with the Applicability Statement for Secure Health Transport.
- Installed the new cert in our environment.
- Revoked the old certificate, if appropriate and feasible.

QA:

- Exchange messages with Direct Transport test tool to verify that we can still connect with HISPs that we were already able to.
- If possible, work with at least one of the four HISPs that could not communicate with us due to this error.  This information is available in the ConnectShare under "Direct Connect-A-Thon".
title: Direct Interop: Update CONNECT's Direct Certificate per Spec

description:
CONN-1096 details the issues with deploying the CONNECTAdminGUI WAR as part of the CONNECT-JB7 EAR.  The combination of JBoss AS / WildFly bug fixes that allow for a WAR with a custom JSF implementation to be included within an EAR were not brought together in a single build until WildFly 8.0.0.

We should investigate whether or not an EAR containing the CONNECTAdminGUI can be built in a way that will deploy and run successfully on WildFly 8.  If the fixes are simple, they should be included as part of this ticket.

Time box to 2 days.

CC:

If evidence exists that this task is not possible, document this information similar to what was done for CONN-1096.

Otherwise, attempt to build an EAR that can be deployed successfully to WildFly 8 when built with all profiles.  If this goal cannot be reached within the time box, document any steps tried and the accompanying errors.

If the described EAR can be deployed successfully to WildFly 8, build the EAR without CONNECTAdminGUI and determine if it can also be deployed to JBoss 7.1.1; if it cannot, make a separate wildfly profile under Deploy so we can take advantage of both builds.

Either way, document any setup steps that are meaningfully different than the instructions available for our JBoss 7.1.1 binary install.

QA:

- Verify that links to all documentation created for this ticket have been provided in the resolution details.  Review this documentation for clarity.

- If a new profile was created, use that profile to build CONNECT with and without activating the "AdminGUI" profile (otherwise, continue to use the "jboss7" profile).  Verify that both EARS can be deployed to WildFly 8 (it is the responsibility of whoever completes this ticket to provide you with a clean WildFly 8 install).  ValidationSuite should run on this deployment, as well as the CONNECTAdminGUI smoke tests.
title: CONNECTAdminGUI - Investigate Deployment on WildFly 8

We would like for any pages with live data to dynamically refresh, with an option to pause the data refresh.

Any Admin GUI pages with live statistics should be updated asynchronously.

QA:

While accessing the Remote Gateway tab

1)  Verify that dynamic update is (by default) not paused.
2)  Run ValidationSuite; do not pause during execution.  You should see the numbers in the table update.
3)  Pause dynamic refresh, then run ValidationSuite.  No numbers should update.
4)  During (or after) the running of ValidationSuite from the previous step, unpause dynamic refresh; the data should shortly thereafter.
5)  Repeat steps 1-4 on Server Dashboard (watch memory usage).
title: CONNECTAdminGUI - Dynamic Refresh for Data

description:
Currently, the username for CONNECT Admin GUI is cached server-side -- this means that if I log in from my local machine, the next person to load the login page from ANY machine will have the page prepopulated with my username.

The username field should either be blank on load, or prepopulated with a value from local cache.

CC:

Username is not cached server-side.

QA:

1. From any machine, attempt to log in as a non-existent user.
2. From a DIFFERENT machine than step 1, attempt to log in as a DIFFERENT non-existent user.
3. From the same machine as step #1, reload the login page.  The username field should NOT be prepopulated with the username used in step #2.

Note:  You local laptop and your GFE server are considered different machines, so only one physical laptop is needed to test this.
title: CONNECTAdminGUI - Username cached server-side

description:
Currently, the CONNECT Admin GUI's login page only works for the happy path.  For exception paths, we mostly see the login fail with nothing on the page to indicate why.  Below are the scenarios where this occurs:

1. Empty user, any password (including blank).
2. Existing user, wrong password (including blank).
3. Non-existent user, blank password.

Interestingly, there is one exception path that fails differently than above:

1. Non-existent user, any password (excluding blank) - Throws a stack trace (abridged exception below):

javax.el.ELException: /Login.xhtml at line 85 and column 126 action="#{loginBean.invokePatient()}": java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
        ...
Caused by: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
        ...
        at gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.admingui.hibernate.dao.UserLoginDAOImpl.login(UserLoginDAOImpl.java:60)
        at gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.admingui.hibernate.LoginServiceImpl.login(LoginServiceImpl.java:82)

We need the Login page to throw meaningful errors for failed logins, and also handle thrown exceptions gracefully.

CC:

All exception paths listed above throw a meaningful (left to the assignee's judgment) error message.
Override JSF default warning/error message using the Message-bundle feature and add custom error messages
QA:

Attempt the four exception paths listed above and verify that a user-friendly error message is displayed which covers the tested exception path (e.g., "Incorrect username or password" would be fine for a non-existent user test case, but not "Incorrect password").

Note:  Where appropriate, test blank and non-blank passwords as two separate test cases.
title: CONNECTAdminGUI - Fix exception paths for Login page

description:
HISTORY:

CONNECT 3.x is limiting the number of results being returned in the UDDI query. SSA would like to investigate options to prevent this from happening.
Prelim analysis - 
It appears that it’s hardcoded to 100. 

You can see the two impls for HP UDDI and jUDDI below:
https://github.com/CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT/blob/3.3/Product/Production/Common/CONNECTCoreLib/src/main/java/gov/hhs/fha/nhinc/connectmgr/uddi/proxy/UDDIFindBusinessProxyHPImpl.java
https://github.com/CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT/blob/3.3/Product/Production/Common/CONNECTCoreLib/src/main/java/gov/hhs/fha/nhinc/connectmgr/uddi/proxy/UDDIFindBusinessProxyJuddiV3Impl.java

It doesnt seem that this has been changed even in 4.x. 

A simple option would be to update that value with a configuration parameter

Current partner (SSA) workaround or impact:
At this point, it’s only impacting our test environment, as the test UDDI has over 100 entries in it.

We are currently on our way to deploying 4.x, so I think we can survive in the near term without a 3.x fix.  We have the option of manually adding to the internalConnectionInfo.xml

CC:

Provide the ability to configure the number results returned in a UDDI query via a configuration parameter .
title: CONNECT is limiting the number of results being returned in the UDDI query to 100

description:
Currently:

- Including CONNECTAdminGUI in the CONNECT EAR as a skinny war causes deployment to fail.
- Including CONNECTAdminGUI in the CONNECT EAR as a mostly-skinny war (only including the myfaces-bundle and directly related jars) allows it to deploy, but fails at runtime.
- Including the full CONNECTAdminGUI war, with all dependencies in the war lib folder, in the CONNECT EAR allows it to deploy and run successfully.

We want to investigate whether or not the included libraries can be pruned further, to decrease the size of our deployment artifact.

Of note: Although this is not a conclusive list, these classes (and their direct dependencies) will almost definitely be required:

- myfaces-bundle
- commons-beanutils
- commons-codec
- commons-collections
- commons-digester
- jstl
- guice
- el-impl
- jsp-api
- servlet-api

As an investigation ticket timebox this ticket to one day.

CC:

- Issue has been investigated; any relevant results have been documented, even if a "skinnier" war has not been made.
- If a "skinnier" war has been made, deploy and test basic functionality.

QA:

- See CC; if relevant, verify that results have been documented and/or the newest deployment artifact is smaller than earlier ones.
title: Investigate making "skinnier" CONNECTAdminGUI war

description:
The use of the deployment descriptor sun-web.xml has been deprecated in favor of:
- glassfish-web.xml in GlassFish 3.1.x
- weblogic.xml in WebLogic 12c

"The glassfish-web.xml file configures a web application (WAR file)."
"The sun-application.xml, sun-web.xml, sun-ejb-jar.xml, sun-application-client.xml, and sun-resources.xml deployment descriptors are supported for backward compatibility."
- http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E26576_01/doc.312/e24929/dd-files.htm
(GlassFish 3.1.2)

"If a Web application has both glassfish-web.xml and sun-web.xml, WebLogic Server will use glassfish-web.xml and ignore sun-web.xml."
- http://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1212/wls/WBAPP/glassfish_dd.htm
(WebLogic 12c; quote also found in the 11gR1 documentation)

CC:

- CONNECT deploys successfully.
- All Gateway projects have a glassfish-web.xml and a weblogic.xml, but do not have a sun-web.xml.

QA:

- See CC.
- ValidationSuite runs successfully against the new deployment.
title: Switch from sun-web.xml to glassfish-web.xml and weblogic.xml

description:
Currently, the CONNECTDirectConfig SoapUI project is not robust.  Problems with the current project include:

1.  TestCases within a TestSuite MUST be run in order
2.  Tests use hard-coded id values, so tests must be updated between executions, or run on a fresh db instance.
3.  TestSteps often do not check for relevant assertions (e.g., XPath Queries for verifying content).
4.  The current TestSuites are written only to test the exposed SOAP services (e.g., getSetting and updateSetting); tests should also be written for use cases (e.g., have a single TestCase with the following steps: 1.  Get a setting and assert the value is as expected  2.  Updating the setting value  3. Getting the setting and assert the value was updated as expected)

These steps may or may not involve configuring a database connection to query against configdb before or after steps.

CC:

- TestCases are able be executed in any order (TestSteps within each case are still expected to be run in order).
- Every test that returns more information than a blank response has assertions to check the content.
- Negative test cases have been added (e.g., adding a domain that already exists).

QA:

- Review TestCases to see if any expected use cases are missing.
- Verify that TestCases can be run out of order.
- Verify that all TestCases pass.
title: CONNECTDirectConfig SoapUI Project Improvements

description:
HISTORY: 
CONNECT 4.0 includes Direct support as per the specifications for HISP to HISP cases. There is an implementation guide for edge protocols that can be found here - http://wiki.directproject.org/file/view/Implementation%20Guide%20for%20Direct%20Edge%20Protocols%20v1.0.pdf/483264676/Implementation%20Guide%20for%20Direct%20Edge%20Protocols%20v1.0.pdf
Requirements related to this feature and associated specification references and requirements can be found at - https://developer.connectopensource.org/x/AgBVCQ

BUSINESS VALUE: 
Senders are kept informed of whether Direct messages initiated by them have been delivered or not to the final destination utilizing Processed notification tracking.

DETAIL: 
Direct messages initiated from CONNECT whether initiated via SOAP+XDR edge or via SMTP edge shall have the ability to include Processed notification requests indicating that they are tracking delivery using Processed notifications

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
1)	Specific Direct Messages initiated from CONNECT include the delivery notification request in the Direct messages sent out to the Sending STAs.
a.	A Direct HISP SHALL support Disposition-Notification-Options header as specified by Section 2.2 of RFC 3798 with a parameter named support X-DIRECT-DELIVER-PROCESSED-MDN.
            The X-DIRECT-DELIVER-PROCESSED-MDN parameter SHALL have an importance of “optional” and a value of “true”.
b.	Messages initiated via SMTP edge or the SOAP edge, include a notification request in the Direct message
c.	Direct messages will have a message Id in the message ID header that can help correlating the Message with the MDN and the delivery notifications. (current functionality)
title: As a CONNECT adopter sending Direct messages, I want to have the ability to inform the Sending STA that I am using Processed notifications for delivery tracking

description:
When a user runs a SoapUI test, they must make sure to set GatewayPropDir before running any SoapUI test suites.  We would like a way to set the value once in a way that will be read by all tests but not associated with any individual projects when checking in to source control.

One way to achieve this is to add a global property key/value pair and add the following to the return statement for "findProperty" in the load script for each project:

?: com.eviware.soapui.SoapUI.globalProperties.getPropertyValue(propertyName)

CC:

All SoapUI tests that rely on "GatewayPropDir" can be run by leaving the project-level property blank, but filling in the global property.

QA:

In addition to CC, setting the project-level property should take precedence over the global property; this can be tested by setting the global property to an illegal value and the project-level property to a legal value.
title: SoapUI Enhancement: Add Support for Global Properties to Existing Projects

description:
Currently, various adapters get endpoint URLs in inconsistent ways; the WebServiceProxyHelper is instantiated and called in different ways for each, the calls to WSProxyHelper are done differently (in ways that are difficult to trace).

Also, certain logic is duplicated in every adapter/Nhin interface (e.g., checking for a null URL) which would make more sense to write in one common place, such as the WSProxyHelper.

We need to identify a way to call URLs consistently; in cases where the method of getting the endpoint is truly different, the WSProxyHelper should make it as transparent and easy to trace as possible.

Note:  A good starting point is to check <Adapter>Core Projects in ../Product/Production/Services/ and packages like gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.<Adapter>/<Nhin>.entity.proxy.Entity<Adapter>/Nhin>ProxyWebServiceSecuredImpl for each adapter.

CC:

- Adapters have been refactored to minimize duplicate code, and behave similarly where duplicate code is inevitable (e.g., instantiation of WSProxyHelper)
- Core Projects and WSProxyHelper as needed, have been refactored to get URLs in as uniform a manner as possible.

QA:

- Code review: specifically, look to make sure the code is cleaner, there is less duplicate code, and tracing where a ConnectionManager / WSProxyHelper function leads is logical.
- ValidationSuite passes; also check at least one negative test-case suite (e.g., PDInternalErrorMsgId)
title: Code Cleanup: Adapter URLs (ConnectionManager)

description:
HISTORY: 
CONNECT 4.0 includes Direct support as per the specifications for HISP to HISP cases. There is an implementation guide for edge protocols and guidance - http://wiki.directproject.org/file/view/Implementation%20Guide%20for%20Direct%20Edge%20Protocols%20v1.0.pdf/483264676/Implementation%20Guide%20for%20Direct%20Edge%20Protocols%20v1.0.pdf

Requirements related to this feature and associated specification references and requirements can be found  at - https://developer.connectopensource.org/x/AgBVCQ

BUSINESS VALUE: 
Enables adopters to track message delivery and count for MU requirements

DETAIL: 
Direct messages initiated from CONNECT whether initiated via SOAP+XDR edge or via SMTP edge shall have the ability to include notification requests.  Per the edge  Implementation guide, the edges may request notifications based on the MDN Processed notification received by the HISP or the MDN Positive or Negative delivery notification received from the final destinations. The edge can indicate to the Sending HISP how they wish to track these notifications based on their capabilities or use cases. i.e. in the case of lab/CLIA based usecases, the edges require tracking based on the delivery to the final destination, but other use cases do not need that. For MU either counting works. T

SMTP Edge and SOAP edge indicates to the CONNECT via the edge message what kind of tracking it would be using. 
The implementation guide explains how these requests are defined both in the SMTP and the XDR edge.
1)	CONNECT tracks delivery notifications based on the final destination delivery
     a.	The MDN request SHALL contain a Disposition-Notification-Options header (as specified by Section 2.2 of RFC3798) with a parameter named X-DIRECT-FINAL-DESTINATION-DELIVERY. This parameter SHALL have an importance of optional and a value of true.
     b.	Messages initiated via SMTP edge, include a delivery notification request in the Direct message
     c.	Direct messages will have a message Id in the message ID header that can help correlating the Message with the MDN and the delivery notifications. (current functionality)
2)CONNECT tracks delivery notifications based on the MDN Processed notification received
       a.	  A Direct HISP SHALL support Disposition-Notification-Options header as specified by Section 2.2 of RFC 3798 with a parameter named support X-DIRECT-DELIVER-PROCESSED-MDN. 
      b.	The X-DIRECT-DELIVER-PROCESSED-MDN parameter SHALL have an importance of “optional” and a value of “true”.
       c.     The Edge system SHALL include a message-id header as specified in RFC5322 to permit automatic correlation with its associated processed MDN message and delivery notification message when used for tracking purposes

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
GUI interface to enable searching and tracking Direct messages and delivery status
title: As a HISP supporting SMTP and XDR edge, I want a GUI interface to track notifications for both MDN Processed and Delivery tracking methods to support my trading partners use cases

description:
The Standard mode TransactionIdTest passes when we ran the test after a fresh deploy or re-start of server. The TransactionIDTest fails when it is executed after executing a passthru case using JMX API. This happens because EventLogging assertion count  fails.

The EventLogging autowiring is done in the classes which is instantiated by JMX API while switching to standard mode. For Example In outbound the StandardOutboundPatientDiscovery class is instantiated and the testcase expects is working fine in standard mode but event firing is not happening the way that is instantiated.

Fix the event logging for OutboundProcessingEvent and  InboundProcessingEvent. These Standard Inbound/Outbound and Passthru Inbound/Outbound classes has to be instantiated through Spring container so that autowiring works.

Link to Event Logging Design Approach
https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONNECTWIKI/Approach+for+Logging+Events+in+CONNECT

CC:
The TransactionIDTest should pass even after executing any passthru test case.
Refer EventLogging-Standard Suite in order to get EventLogging count for any service. Make sure all Services has the expected event logging count. Update unit tests.
To test, start the gateway in standard mode, run event logging standard, passthru, then standard again regression suites. Then restart the gateway in passthru and run the passthru event logging regression test.
title: Fix EventLogging for OutboundProcessingEvent and InboundProcessingEvent  in case of Switching Gateway from Passthrough to Standard mode.

description:
The Implementation Guide for Direct Edge Protocols v1.0 provides guidance about the XDR implementation using WS-ReliableMessaging (WS-RM) 1.2 and discusses how SOAP messages can be reliably delivered between distributed applications in the presence of software component, system, or network failures.

While CONNECT's Direct implementation supports the XDR edge there is no reliable way of indicating back to the edge the success or failure of delivery notifications or processed notifications. 

Completion critieria:
Document research findings as to how WS-reliable messaging can be used with the current XDR edge implementation.
Create tickets for implementing reliable messaging.
title: Investigate the use of Reliable Messaging with XDR edge for Direct

CC:
Provide comments in this ticket with the results of the investigation. Create ticket(s) to implement recommendation.

One person - two day effort ceiling for this ticket
title: Investigate the use of direct RI's message monitor logic backed by event logging data

description:
In the past we have heard that Apache James has some security vulnerabilities that may not pass DoD security checks. Before we get too further into development of Direct, it would be good to assess the impact of introducing APache James as a CONNECT dependency. Based on this assessment we can determine whether this is an option that will be feasible for the partners or not.

There are a few tickets that are created for investigating and researching how James will be utilized in CONNECT such that it can be embedded and will work on all supported application servers. As part of that research, we may need to assess how secure the code is if we introduce Apache James as a CONNECT dependency.

CC: Run the Fortify scan on Apache James war code and assess any security issues identified.
title: Execute Fortify scan on CONNECT code when the Apache James mailet has been embedded into CONNECT to assess impact

description:
We need to find a replacement for the current Spring-based chron implementation, which we have previously found to problematic (specifically, around the initialization of Hibernate utilities). The Direct RI message monitor uses Apache Camel, but we cannot use this approach due to issues discovered on deployment to JBoss 7 and Weblogic 12c.

This implementation will be used for polling, message monitoring (Direct QoS), and Trust Bundle refresh.

CC:

- Document findings and recommendations in the comments or resolution details of this ticket.
- Create a new ticket to implement these recommendations.

QA:

- Review the comments, resolution details, and new ticket as appropriate.
title: Task Scheduling: Investigate Replacements for the Current Spring-Based Chron Implementation

description:

When checked in the Event Logging tests, in passthru mode the event counts are PD - 8, RD - 8 and DQ - 8 should exist and in standard mode the event counts are PD - 14, RD - 12 and DQ - 12. When the PD-QD-RD test case from TransactionIDTest is executed, we are getting PD-10, DQ-8 and RD-8. The following PD events are generated:

description:
This service should implement the Direct RI WSDLs so that existing Direct RI components which we use can use config services in the CONNECT stack. There are RESTful services in Direct RI (the newest versions) but we'll focus on the SOAP versions for now. This service is a CONNECT reference adapter. This ticket is implemented by CONN-1033, and CONN-1034 so this ticket only includes points for testing.

The goal of this implementation is to have a Spring/Hibernate implementation using a container-managed datasource that fits into the CONNECT tech stack.

CC:

Test by populating with Direct RI config GUI and CONNECT Direct implementation:

1) Add/remove/update for trust bundles
2) Add/remove/update for domains
3) Add/remove for anchor/leaf certificates
4) Add/remove for agent settings
title: As a CONNECT developer I want to create direct configuration services which fit into the CONNECT techstack.

description:
Pollers, XDR, and Standalone/embedded James mailets can all be used as fascade services in front of this service if it is exposed as a service. Potentially expose the receiveInbound method here: https://github.com/CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT/blob/CONNECT_integration/Product/Production/Services/DirectCore/src/main/java/gov/hhs/fha/nhinc/direct/DirectReceiverImpl.java

This implementation should also have a proxy factory client to initiate ws/java calls.

CC:
create and expose an interfaces via java + web services to process direct messages.
create a client which is capable of calling this interface.
test using all methods available (pollers, xdr, james standalone/embedded)
unit + integration (soapui) tests are a must
title: Refactor and expose process direct message method as a service

description:
https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FCPT/Large+payload+testing

Go through this document again to specify what configurations are for the local machine and what configurations are for the remote machine. Also, sometimes document path names are returned instead of actual documents. This has been fixed by switching between encoded values of path+filename and absolute values. Document which ones should be used for Doc Submission and Doc Retrieve.

CC: Be able to use the document to implement Large File Transfer step by step
title: Update Large File Transfer Testing documentation

description:
Since we are not supporting HIEM as part of our Product suite. Some or most of the soapUI projects property files still refer or hold lot of HIEM related properties. Need to remove those entries from Validation Suite and Regression Suite.

CC:
Removing HIEM related properties from project properties file under regression suite and Validation suite.
title: Remove HIEM related properties from various soapUI Property files.

description:
A number of CONNECT issues have been raised around the use of the mvn eclipse:eclipse plugin (on the windows environment) including CONN-284, and GATEWAY-3030. According to a post of the mvn eclipse plugin JIRA (http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MECLIPSE-608) the problem could be related to the use of $basedir in the src element. In my experience this is required for building the CONNECT product. 

Investigate removing $basedir from the src elements and see if we can get the projects to build with out it. Start with core lib.
title: Investigate removing $basedir from mvn src elements in pom.xmls to help generate Eclipse artifacts

description:
The team has identified improvements that should be incorporated into our testing with regards to Performance, Interoperability, Unit testing, and Regression to improve overall testing and coverage for the product
CC
Have a meeting to discuss what is lacking with regards to test coverage and feature/functionality testing and create tickets for testing improvements
title: Discuss gaps in testing coverage

description:
This is a RESEARCH TICKET.

The latest version of Apache Webservice Security for Java (WSS4J) is available with several fixes mentioned below:
http://coheigea.blogspot.ie/2014_01_01_archive.html
http://coheigea.blogspot.ie/2014_02_01_archive.html
http://coheigea.blogspot.ie/2014_03_01_archive.html

The above Blog specify various fixes done related to:
TimeStamp
UserName Token
SAML Assertions
WS-Security Policy
RealTime Streaming
Secure messaging with attachments.

Analyze the new features available and see how they can be used in our product to take advantage of some of the fixes available as part of upgrade.

https://ws.apache.org/wss4j/newfeatures20.html
title: As a Connect Developer would like to update Gateway with new version of Apache WSS4J

description:
Fortify Priority: High
1 Issue

Abstract:

The top-level function or procedure update_blob_data in populateTestData_oracle.sql does not define an AUTHID clause and therefore defaults to AUTHID DEFINER.


Explanation:

PL/SQL functions and procedures can be either AUTHID DEFINER or AUTHID CURRENT_USER. Functions and procedures with definer's rights execute under the privileges of the user that defines the code. This can allow updates and access to specific pieces of data without granting access to entire tables or schemas. With invoker's rights, or AUTHID CURRENT_USER, functions and procedures execute under the privileges of the user who invokes them. This does not allow a user to gain access to data it didn't already have access to. If no AUTHID clause is provided, the function or procedure defaults to definer's rights. 

Functions and procedures are usually defined by SYS or another highly privileged user, making any exploits of the code potentially more dangerous.

CC:

Identify and implement the appropriate AUTHID clause to limit the access given to the function.

QA:

The issue should be resolved upon subsequent Fortify scans, and the database script should still populate test data as expected.
title: Address "Privilege Management: Default Function or Procedure Rights" Fortify scan results

description:
HISTORY:
Direct transport was included in CONNECT 4.0 and included support for the Applicability statement and XDR and XDM for Direct messaging. CONNECT leveraged the Direct Reference Implementation to provide this functionality. Direct is now included in the MU2 regulations as a required transport. The goal of this story is to collaborate with the NIST team and execute the NIST test cases that have been created for MU2 validation to assess any deltas and ensure that CONNECT meets those requirements laid out by MU2 for Direct transport

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:
nformation on the NIST tool and user guide can be found here

NIST Tool - http://transport-testing.nist.gov/ttt/
User Guide - http://healthcare.nist.gov/docs/TransportTestingTool--User_Guide.pdf
To be determined


BUSINESS VALUE:
Support adopters using CONNECT to meet MU2 requirements and seeking ONC 2014 certificationI

Completion Critieria:
Execute MU2 test cases related to Direct and XDR/XDM for Direct messaging.
Create tickets/stories for test cases that do not pass
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want CONNECT to be tested with the MU2 test cases for Direct related transports to enable my CONNECT implementation to be certified for MU2/ONC 2014 certification

title: Process/Procedure Improvements - Investigate JIRA Functionality

description:
Many of the CONNECT team's SDLC processes, such as the proper workflow for a Jira ticket, are not documented.  As a team, we should capture existing processes and continually update them as they evolve.

Processes should not be confused with procedures; the latter describes how we do something, the former describes what and why.  For example, Git process documentation is not in place to explain that a user should work against their own repository, even though procedure documentation is in place to show a user how to do this.

CC:

- Create a parent page for CONNECT team processes.
- If appropriate, add in basic process information, to be fleshed out later.  This may involve creating child pages.
- Create tickets to cover each major process.
- Optional:  Drive a brown bag to discuss this ticket; capture notes either on the wiki or as JIRA tickets.

QA:

- Verify that a parent page has been created.
- Verify that any information added as part of this ticket, if any, is accurate and placed appropriately.
- Verify that any new ticket's description, CC, and QA information are thorough. These tickets should all support CONN-926.
title: Investigate capturing CONNECT team SDLC processes

description:
Each sprint, the CONNECT team reflects on ways to improve the SDLC processes in place, and as a result, those have been fine-tuned over time.  While this retrospective is important, we should also aspire to actively improve our processes.

Some processes are in place, but they have not been documented.  For example, the team has agreed to comment on a ticket when beginning QA, but a new team member would not know to do this.
 
Some processes are where we need them to be, but upgrades to our tools make the procedures easier.  For example, identifying "S+T" as the keyboard shortcut for sending an issue to the top of the backlog in JIRA will cumulatively save a lot of time and frustration while achieving the same end result.

Some processes can be actively improved.  For example, the team could research a way to use JIRA to create a map between related requirements, improvements, bug fixes, etc.  This information could help determine if the information in a particular ticket is deprecated, or if changing a particular section of code will negatively impact another ticket.
title: As a CONNECT team member, I want to continually improve our SDLC processes so that we can track, report on, and map artifacts such as requirements, bug fixes, and pull requests.

description:
Currently, CONNECT 4.X build/install documentation has links to several child pages under CONNECT 4.0.  This may cause confusion when installing non-4.0 release as the links will put them under the document tree for a different release.

Some suggestions to prevent confusion when navigating between different sections of the wiki:
- Move these child pages to the a generic "CONNECT" or "CONNECT 4.X" parent page.
- For navigation consistency, copy the child pages under the CONNECT install instructions page for every release moving forward. 

CC:

Report on which scheme makes the most sense; if the team agrees on a resolution that is:
- A simple copy / move of pages: complete as part of this ticket.
- More complex / involved: create a new ticket.

QA:

If resolved:  Verify that the resolution details accurately describe the solution, and that the solution has been implemented as described.
If not resolved:  Verify that the new ticket's description, CC, and QA information are thorough.  These tickets should all support CONN-922.
title: Investigate Organization of Non-Version-Specific CONNECT Documentation

description:
Update build & install documentation to:

1. Follow a template - Documentation should be organized in a way that a reader can easily navigate, and a CONNECT team member can easily identify sections to update between releases.
2. Remove duplicate information - Like code, avoid duplicate information when possible.  Create an anchor to the information or pull it to its own page, and let other pages reference it.

CC:

For the next release's build & install documentation:

- Documentation is templated / organized
- Information is only duplicated when appropriate
- Documentation flows linearly (to the extent that it makes sense)

QA:

Whether or not the completion criteria has been met is left as a judgment call to the QA'er.
title: Organize Build/Install Documentation

description:
Build and install documentation needs to be organized linearly, with duplicate information removed (if multiple pages need the same information, they can link to a single page containing it).  The documentation should also follow a template to facilitate the process of identifying sections that need to be updated between releases.

Also, to prevent confusion when navigating between different sections of the wiki, documentation that is not specific to any release should either:
- not be child pages to the CONNECT 4.0 install instructions page.
- be copied as child pages to every CONNECT 4.X install instructions page.
title: As a CONNECT development team member, I want to improve build/install documentation so that it can be easily maintained and navigated.

description:
The Product team received a response from the DoD regarding their review of the Fortify scan mitigation response supplied.  The DoD team found one particular issue regarding the mitigation responses.

The Product team needs to review this finding, determine what additional response should be made and then estimate the effort to complete the new response.  Then the team can determine if this can or should be included in release 4.3.   

The DoD response below:

Greg/Matthew,
Attached spread sheet will provide details of our analysis. The SCQC team is comfortable with all the justifications/code fixes except one (XML External Entity Injection), for which we have provided our comment.
 
We also did a quick comparison of our Fortify environment with yours and the only difference is in the SCA version. We will work at our end to update that. 
 
We did a quick scan of the source code that we got (https://github.com/CONNECT-Solution/CONNECT/tree/4.3-Fortify) and noticed a significant difference in the number of files and lines of code (executable and total). With that said, I would like to recommend a quick session to go over the scanning details with your team to ensure we are consistent across the board. We also want to make sure we scanned the same code base.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
 
 
Kavin Shelat
IPO IQA Support Contractor
SCQC Lead

Completion criteria:
Address the issue related to XML Entity injection and update the Fortify documentation wiki page
title: Evaluate and Estimate DoD Exception Finding in the Fortify Scan Mitigation Response

description:
1)	Portal
a.	Patient search is on Cindy Williams – however the style sheet shows Cindy Winters – needs to be fixed
b.	Documents list page shows Summarization of Episode (This is probably hardcoded) or some error in the metadata during submission since 34108-1 is the LOINC code for Outpatient note whereas the document that is being displayed is a Summarization of episode note (“34133-9”) ----Can we change the metadata that is being stored in the registry to reflect 34133-9 for the document, that way the docs are in sync. It also could be that the Portal is not pulling the doc type but maybe the class code in any case the document type does not match the note that is being displayed. 
c.	We should add another document that was provided as test data (see attached – this was from Breast Cancer Treatment Plan Summary report. ) maybe to the same patient –basically change the patient to be Cindy in the xml and   DOB and then that should work. We may need to work with the submission to make sure that the correct metadata is added to the repo.

2)	UC 
a.	Patient search is on Cindy Williams – however the style sheet shows Cindy Winters – needs to be fixed
b.	Every time an action is performed on any of the Patient correlation or Documents page it brings back the user to the Patient search page which is very confusing. 
i.	On Patient correlation page, after the Patient discovery is complete let the user be on the same page to see the results – doesn’t make sense to get him back to search page. Or maybe I am missing something here..
ii.	On Documents page too, after the Query, the user is taken back to the search w/o having a chance to see the query results.
c.	Selecting a patient from the local MPI should allow the user to see the patient correlations as indicated in the instructions on the page, however the same search page is displayed. Redirect to correlations and save an extra click, avoid confusion
d.	Broadcast messages and Patient Information Query -> don’t understand when these alerts are displayed. sometimes they are displayed in a local search even though no external PD broadcast was done. So very confusing. 
e.	Warning message indicating –“ action will take several minutes” should disappear after action is complete. It lingers on and it is not clear whether action was complete or not.
f.	If a previous search has been executed and a new search w/o any parameters is done so as to reset -> the documents pane still shows the old patient documents.

description:
When a QD request is asking for onDemand docs, it sends:

<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryType">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>('urn:uuid:34268e47-fdf5-41a6-ba33-82133c465248')</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>

Our adapter then looks for an onDemand value of '1' in the database.

When a QD request is asking for a stable doc, it sends:

<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryType">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>('urn:uuid:7edca82f-054d-47f2-a032-9b2a5b5186c1')</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>

Our adapter then looks for an onDemand value of '0' in the database.

When an RD request comes in, we return a document when the onDemand value is set to '0' but we are currently returning no document when the onDemand value is set to '1'.

This ticket is to research why we are not returning a document when the onDemand value in the database is set to '1'.

- Most likely, just need to add/change data in the document record
- Possibly an adapter bug that needs to be fixed

This has already been fixed, and regression tests have been created.

CC: 
Test the regression test for the QD/RD scenarios related to On demand and stable documents retrieval
- If QD requests do not have a DocumentEntryType or request for Stable documents return Stable document entries ONLY
- If QD requests have a DocumentEntryType of On demand documents return On Demand document entries ONLY
- If QD requests have a DocumentEntryType of On demand and Stable documents return On Demand and Stable document entries
- RD requests works successfully for On demand andStable documents
title: Fix QD and RD adapters to support OnDemand and Stable document retrieval

description:
Entity Document Query Secured implements an operation which has a parameter of RetrieveDocumentSetRequestType as request. This is causing issues in further processing by missing NhinTargetCommunities. The current implementation is passing null value as hard coded value and causing issue in processing.

CC:
Run Validation Tests.
Configure soapUI in 2-way SSL mode and initiate a Entity Document Query Secured Request message to perform the test.
If soapUI doesn't work then create a proxy class which make a call to a secured interface from unsecured.
title: Entity Document Query secured services throwing errors

description:
Entity RD Secured service implements a method respondingGatewayCrossGatewayRetrieve. This method is using ihe.iti.xds_b._2007.RetrieveDocumentSetRequestType as parameter and ihe.iti.xds_b._2007.RetrieveDocumentSetResponseType as response. This method is incorrectly formatted with request/response types. The request message doesn't have NhinTargetCommunities to extract and set to Entity interface. So, this parameter is hard coded as null when sending the request message for further processing in Gateway. 

CC:
Fix this issue in both the projects _20 and _30.
Run Validation Tests.
Configure soapUI to use 2-way SSL and perform a Entity Document Retrieve Secured request and perform test.
title: Entity Document Retrieve Secured Service Throws Errors

description:
Email from Paul

I just discovered something doing some inbound load testing, generating a load of concurrent dq/dr requests that are sent to a 3.x requesting gateway, which forwards to a 4.2 response gateway, that then forwards the requests to our dod vler adapter.  If you make a single request, or run with a concurrent load of just 1, all is fine.  However, when I increase to even just 5 concurrent, the 4.2 gateway starts throwing soap fault exceptions about the ws-security header timestamp and replay attack (see attached log file from gateway).  The log file is from the 4.2 gateway messages.log, where at 11:11 and 11:12 AM I am just running single request/load of 1 concurrent, and then starting at 11:13 AM I started running a load of maybe 5 concurrent, which is where the exceptions start blowing up everywhere.

I did some digging and found that this appears to be a cxf bug (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-4294) but that is over a year old and appears to be fixed?  Since I was having same issue (even though gateway is using cxf-bundle-2.7.3 and so would think it is fixed), and added the referenced (below) props to the endpoint configs in the webservices.xml of each of the war files, replaced the wars in the ear with my updated wars and re-deployed ear…….the issue completely goes away with these settings on the 4.2 endpoints


<jaxws:properties>
... 
<entry key="ws-security.enable.nonce.cache" value="false" />
<entry key="ws-security.enable.timestamp.cache" value="false" />
</jaxws:properties>

Paul

P.S.  We are running connect 4.2 gateway on IBM WAS with Liberty Profile………thought I would mention this as I have found a number of strange things/issues with our adapter code running under WAS Liberty that are unique to WAS/IBM JDK, so this may be an issue only on WAS.
title: Investigate and research issue when concurrent messages are sent from connect 3.x gateway to connect 4.2 gateway

description:
Some CONNECT junit tests require state set up in previously executed (sometimes, hence the problem) unit tests. Per maven/junit/surefire conventions every unit test should be stateless and capable of being run in any order or by itself. Please see this forum post for more details: http://forums.connectopensource.org/CONNECT-4-2-Problems-with-JUnit-Tests-tp7579008.html

CC: update junit tests so that all of the reported test cases can be run by themselves. Ensure all CI jobs pass before closing this ticket (PRV, Merge, nightly), and run each test case individually to prove no statefulness exists.
title: Resolve known "statefulness" in unit tests

description:
Modify Maven scripts to always build Direct modules, but only include Direct modules in the CONNECT EAR when the Direct profile is active.

CC:

- When running the build WITH the Direct profile, Direct modules and JARs SHOULD be built and also included in the EAR.
- When running the build WITHOUT the Direct profile, Direct modules and JARs SHOULD be built but SHOULD NOT included in the EAR.
- Each individual maven script should still run properly, whether or not it is called from a parent script.

QA:

Note: Before each QA step, run "mvn clean -P Direct"

- Build without the Direct profile; verify that Direct has built (check the Direct target directories or the .m2 repo), and also verify that the EAR does not includes any Direct modules.
- Build with the Direct profile; verify that Direct has built (check the Direct target directories or the .m2 repo), and also verify that the EAR includes the expected Direct modules.
- Run a "mvn clean install" with and without the Direct profile active on the following poms under "Services/DirectCore" and "Gateway/Direct"

description:
In researching the parent task it was discovered that the ConfigurationUtilities project is no longer useful for several reasons:

1.  It is a command line utility with no main method and the main class is not public.  The class is not referenced anywhere else in the code (it couldn't be since it's not public).

2. The utility is used to update spring beans.  We have since changed how we do spring by using alias.

CC:  Utilities removed, CI passes.
title: Remove Utilities Project

description:

1. In validation suite - g1 - Document Submission test case request, remove the content for the <urn1:resource> tag.

2. In validation suite - g1 - Document Submission test case request, change the value of Association type for the <urn4:Association> tag to "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:AssociationType:HasMember".

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

- Verify that the changes have been made in the Document Submission test
- Verify that the test passes
title: Document Submission - resource and hasMember changes to validation suite

description:
Since the JMX property is not part of Domain.xml template, we need to add it in domain.xml manually before we test passthru soapuI test.

It is better the have this property in template.

<jvm-options>-Dorg.connectopensource.enablejmx=true</jvm-options>
title: Update JMX option in Domain.xml template

description:
Post release 3.3, HIEM has not been maintained in the CONNECT product. We also do not have any active users implementing this specification on the Exchange. 
As part of the Fortify scan there were many vulnerabilities discovered in the HIEM module. The HIEM module is also not up-to-date  with architectural updates made in 4.0. After discussion with ONC, it has been determined that we can remove this service from the CONNECT code base and archive it. 

COMPLETION CRITERIA: 
Remove/archive HIEM from codebase.
title: As the CONNECT product owner, I want HIEM to be removed from the codebase inorder to remove related security vulnerabilities identified in the scan and to remove technical debt

description:
When a request is sent to NIST having one AttributeStatement tag for each attribute, NIST tool is throwing exception.

To over come this, the code is fixed and tested in a separate branch. Need to make those code changes in the CONNECT branch.

The changed files are:
1. OpenSAML2ComponentBuilder.java
2. HOKSAMLAssertionBuilder.java

CC: Manually verify the correct nesting in logs. Create manual regression test to verify the same. Pass interoperability testing.
title: Add the code to have a single AttributeStatement for multiple attributes for NIST

description:
COMPLETION CRITERIA:
1)Run Fortify and identify all Critical and High issues.
2)Prepare a list and publish on wiki.
3)Address all the issues. In some cases the issues can be fixed by code change. In other cases documentation on wiki needs to be updated to document that the issue is not a vulnerability with appropriate reason and / or references and/or appropriate workarounds or best practices that implementers need to have in place. 
4)Re-Run Fortify and ensure that all tickets are addressed.
5)Follow-up with DoD security team
title: As a CONNECT implementer, I want to address all High and Critical Fortify issues so that the code is secure and compliant with DoD requirements for code quality

description:
Create a CONNECT instance to be used for demo purposes at the HIMSS 2014 Interoperability showcase (23-37 Feb). The use case being demonstrated is Document Submission(CDA document) from an external system into a CONNECT and the ability to query and view the CDA documents via a UI client. This use case can be used in various settings like an immunization registry or disease registry that receives health data from various sources or for a simple data exchange between any two healthcare providers using NwHIN standards. It shows how CONNECT can be used and integrated with other back-end systems via simple custom adapters.
In addition to this, CONNECT will be used to request patient data from an external system and this wil be demonstrated by the UI client as well,

We will use open source tools like Open EMPI and HIEOS as Patient matching and Repository/registry backend systems.

COMPLETION CRITERIA: 
Demonstrate the ability to receive a Document Submission from an external system into CONNECT
Demonstrate the ability to query, retrieve and view the document received via a UI client.
Demonstrate the ability to query documents from an external gateway via a UI client.
title: As an adopter interested in interoperabilty and health data exchange, I want to see a CONNECT demo so that I understand how CONNECT is used to exchange health data and how it interacts with other supporting MPI and repository systems

title: Run Participant test cases with Release 4.2.1 tag

description:
Conemaugh Health System and partners have made significant enhancements to the UniversalClientGUI.

Please see the attachment for an overview.  Code is available from the following link:

http://svn.stormwoods.info:18080/svn/main/trunk/Partners/Conemaugh/CONNECT_Code_Donations/CONNECTUniversalClientGUI
title: UniversalClientGUI Enhancements

description:
The Mural 2.0 NHIN CONNECT MPI adapter is designed to
-  support NHIN CONNECT 3.3
-  support Mural MDM, Mural 2.0 MDM, iOpenMPDM, SUN MDM and Oracle Healthcare MPI
-  support NHIN Patient Discovery specification v2.0
-  support required/optional request and response attributes for NHIN Patient Discovery 
-  support wildchar search
-  support probabilistic search
-  support IHE compliant Patient data model
-  provide secured and non-secured Interfaces

More information is available at the open source community:
https://www.projects.openhealthtools.org/sf/projects/iopenmpdm or http://java.net/projects/mosaic
title: Mural 2.0 NHIN CONNECT MPI Adapter

description:
New requirement not in v 1.0 DTAAP criteria and not in 2014 MU2 criteria:  
Messages must be sent wrapped and HISPs must be capable of receiving wrapped messages.

THis was taken from the HISP Policy requirements presentation during the Jan 2014 Direct Connect-a-thon. There has been discussion about message wrapping in various Direct forums to ensure security.

Some of the key points that have been discussed are --
When you receive a wrapped message you need to unwrap it and assume that the header inside the wrapped message is authoritative.
Comparing the external and internal headers maybe a good practice and possibly audit log a security event if they are not the same.

From a CONNECT perspective I would think we need to both support wrapping of Direct messages as well as have the capability of unwrapping and utilizing the wrapped message
See also CONN-1108 which includes the Paper on the issue and the message wrapping solution.
Per our understanding, Direct RI supports this and since CONNECT leverages the RI code/components, we are assuming that the message wrapping functionality is included. This needs to be validated

CC:
- Test to see if CONNECT already supports message wrapping at the sending side and unwrapping at the recipient side
- If yes, then document n release notes.
-If not, create supporting tickets.
title: Validate whether message wrapping is being implemented in the current RI codebase.

description:
From Authorization Framework spec v 3.0. Fix the Role and validate that the type attribute has the xsi namespace

3.2.2.5 Role Attribute
This <Attribute> element shall have the Name attribute set to “urn:oasis:names:tc:xacml:2.0:subject:role”. The value of the <AttributeValue> element is a child element, “Role”, in the namespace “urn:hl7-org:v3”, whose content is defined by the “CE” (coded element) data type from the HL7 version 3 specification.
The codeSystem is defined to be “2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" and the codeSystemName is defined to be "SNOMED_CT". The Role Element shall contain the SNOMED CT value representing the role that the user is playing when making the request. The value set to be used is “User Role” and the OID 2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.6.1.156
An example of the syntax of this element is as follows: as defined in HITSP C80.
Figure 3.3.2.5-1 Role Attribute Example
<saml:Attribute Name="urn:oasis:names:tc:xacml:2.0:subject:role">
<saml:AttributeValue>
<Role xmlns="urn:hl7-org:v3" xsi:type="CE" code="46255001"
codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT"
displayName="Pharmacist"/>
</saml:AttributeValue>
</saml:Attribute>

CC:
All hl7 elements (Role and PurposeOfUse) in the SAML header should have the type attribute defined as such: xsi:type="hl7:CE".
title: SAML Attribute PurposeOfUse missing namespace for the @type attribute
