description:
This issue was discussed during the Exchange Spec factory call on 4/25/2013 where some implementations use X.509 certs instead of RSAKeyValues. RSAKeyValue is required to be used as identified in the Auth framework specs(v3.0) Section 3.2.4.3. CONNECT uses RSAKeyValues. Also, CONNECT implementations in the Exchange are able to accept(responder) and process the X509 certs as well. Epic failed a couple of the MA test cases during pilot testing and were hoping that X509 certs be allowed since they are richer, and can provide more information if needed.
See forum post for details - http://exchange-specifications.wikispaces.com/share/view/62085530

The RSAKeyValue flavor is tested with all of the existing responder cases in the DIL. In addition, AEGIS has added a new provisional test suite to test the X509Data flavor. Information on that new suite can be found here: See attached document Digital Signature Testing Announcement for testing details.

This ticket is to validate the various flavors of the digital signature key values possible for SAML signature as a responder.

1/3/2014 - AEGIS/HealtheWay will support a responder SUT service set to allow organizations to determine if both forms (RSA and X.509) digital signatures are breaking changes. There will be 6 test cases that would need to be executed as part of this set, 3 for 2010 responder and 3 tests for 2011 response. The service set will have information about the patient and the document set to be used for testing. 

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Execute the test suite(See attached document Digital Signature Testing Announcement for details) provided by the DIL for the responder test cases.
Document findings in the ticket.
Provide information back to eHealth Exchange/Spec factory.
title: Execute new  DIL service test cases that validates if both forms(RSA and X509) are acceptable by CONNECT gateway

description:
MDN dispatched messages should be sent back to the sending STA if they request the notifications, and if the message was successfully dispatched to the edge client.

CC: update code and unit tests to introduce the above functionality. Test these cases:
If the sending STA does not ask for disposition notifications the receiving STA should not send the MDN dispatched.
If the receiving edge client reports an error, the receiving STA should not send the MDN dispatched.
if the sending STA does ask for disposition notifications, and the receiving STA successfully dispatches the message to the edge client, the receiving STA should send the MDN dispatched.
title: Create and send an MDN dispatched message after a message has been successfully sent to the edge client.

description:
1) CONNECT sends a delivery notification in response to a Direct message only if it was requested. 
2)	If delivery notification is not requested then a delivery notification (dispatched or failure) will not be sent.
3)	CONNECT acting as a Receiving STA will always issue a processed MDN once a message has been received and trust and security has been verified as required by the Applicability Statement(current functionality) 
4)	CONNECT shall send out a positive delivery notification upon delivery success (see implementation guide Section 1.1 for details of the MDN message) 
a.	This functionality needs to be supported for both edge scenarios on the responding side - SMTP and SOAP.
title: Verify the Direct functionality

description:
In order to implement ATNA auditing according to specs (common requirement for PD, QD and RD), we need a value of ReplyTo field (coming from WS-Addressing). However, as far as we know, CONNECT doesn't pass WS Addressing headers to us as implementers.
As ATNA auditing requires access to the WS addressing fields, we consider it a bug that CONNECT doesn't pass these fields to us. Or is there any configuration which would make CONNECT to do so?

Refered specs: for PD, it's PD 2.0, section 5: Auditing (the field is specified as conditional there but it's a required field for QD and RD auditing)
title: CONNECT doesn't pass any information about requesting gateway to adapter web services

description:
We have the latest CONNECT 4.2.0 release built and deployed within our DIL QA environment on Glassfish 3.1.2.2. This issue is one that we found during execution of some basic Patient Discovery, Query For Documents and Retrieve Documents test cases.  The outbound SOAP requests were found to have a default, hard-coded value for the SAML Issuer element within the SOAP Header Security section even though a valid X509SubjectName was defined in the gateway's private SSL certificate.

The DIL test rule that failed on the Patient Discovery request message produced the following output:

MA-1031 SAML Assertion: Assertion/saml2:Issuer is an X.509 Subject Name Format and the value of, 'CN=SAML User,OU=SU,O=SAML User,L=Los Angeles,ST=CA,C=US', appears to contain a default value ('SAML User') and not one that properly identifies the requesting organization. See specifications: NwHIN Spec Reference: Authorization Framework 3.0: 3.3(2011) Authorization Framework 2.0: 3.3(2010); Other Reference : OASIS Reference : SAML 2.0: 8.3.3.

CC: Update code to work like this: If a subject name is passed into the gateway on the entity interface, we should continue to honor that value. If no subject name exists we should parse the distinguished name from the client certificate. These changes require a unit test and regression test (you can check for the expected value in an adapter mock service).
title: Default SAML Issuer value being used in all SOAP Header Security sections even though a valid X509SubjectName is defined in the private SSL certificate

description:
We have the latest CONNECT 4.2.0 release built and deployed within our DIL QA environment on Glassfish 3.1.2.2. This issue is one that we found during execution of a basic Patient Discovery request.  The corresponding Patient Discovery response message was found to have an incorrect value for the ControlActProcess code value of 'PRPA_TE201306UV'.  The actual value should be 'PRPA_TE201306UV02'.

The DIL test rule that failed on the Patient Discovery response message produced the following output:
d
CL_PD_Resp_331: ns6:PRPA_IN201306UV02/ns6:controlActProcess/ns6:code/@code value of 'PRPA_TE201306UV' not valid. Only value of 'PRPA_TE201306UV02' is valid. See NwHIN Patient Discovery v2.0, Underlying Specifications: XCPD Section 3.55.4.2.2.3, Table T3.55.4.1.2-2 and HL7:MFMI_MT700711UV01.ControlActProcess and HL7 Domain: Message Control Act Infrastructure, Section 1.2.
title: Patient Discovery response ns6:controlActProcess/ns6:code/@code value from the default MPI adapter is incorrect

description:
We have the latest CONNECT 4.2.0 release built and deployed within our DIL QA environment on Glassfish 3.1.2.2. This issue is one that we found during execution of some basic Patient Discovery, Query For Documents and Retrieve Documents test cases.  The outbound SOAP requests were found to be missing the "mustUnderstand" attribute on the WS Addressing Header elements of: Action, To, ReplyTo and MessageID.

The DIL test rule that failed on the Query For Documents request message produced the following output:

CL QD-3400: /S:Envelope/S:Header/wsa:Action/@mustUnderstand not found in message, but is required. Specification Reference: NwHin Query For Documents: 1.12; Underlying specification: WS-Addressing 1.0, SOAP 1.2: 5.2.2, IHE ITI TF-2x: Table V.3.2-1: IHE_WSA101, IHE ITI TF-2b: Table 3.38.5-2.
title: WS Addressing SOAP Header Elements Missing Required "mustUnderstand" Attribute

CC: Change property "largejobSizePercentStr" in gateway.properties to an integer, then update ExecutorServiceHelper to remove parseDouble.

Test cases:

To test, stop the server.  Set largejobSizePercentStr to the value indicated, start the server, and run any PD test from ValidationSuite.

1.  DEFAULT LEGAL VALUE:  largejobSizePercentStr=75
2.  NON-DEFAULT LEGAL VALUE: largejobSizePercentStr=60 (or any integer between 0 and 100, excluding 75)
3.  ILLEGAL VALUE, HIGH: largejobSizePercentStr=101 (or any integer over 100)
4.  ILLEGAL VALUE, LOW: largejobSizePercentStr=-1 (or any integer under 100)
5.  ILLEGAL VALUE, NON-INTEGER: largejobSizePercentStr=20.2 (or any non-integer between 0 and 100)
6.  ILLEGAL VALUE, NON-NUMBER: largejobSizePercentStr=twenty (or any string)

In all 6 cases, the PD test should pass.  For cases 3-6, but NOT cases 1-2, the following message should appear in the log:
"ExecutorServiceHelper exception loading config properties so using default values".

For all cases, the following message should appear in the log:
"ExecutorServiceHelper created singleton instance and set executor service configuration parameters: concurrentPoolSize=100 largejobPoolSize=200 largejobSizePercent="<largejobSizePercent>
** <largejobSizePercent> should be (.75) for ILLEGAL VALUE test cases, and (largejobSizePercentStr / 100) for LEGAL VALUE test cases.
title: Address Denial of Service: Parse Double Fortify scan results

description:
While performing internal testing of CONNECT 4.2, our examination of the SAML Header Assertion Attributes has found an inconsistency in the purposeofuse HL7 CE coded element value. The type declaration for the PurposeOfUse element is missing where it was expected to defined as type="hl7:CE".

_It was observed that the Role declaration correctly includes the type:_
{code:xml}
<saml2:AttributeValue>
	<hl7:Role xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" code="112247003" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.6.96" codeSystemName="SNOMED_CT" displayName="Medical Doctor" type="hl7:CE"/>
</saml2:AttributeValue>
{code}

_Here is the PurposeOfUse declaration for comparison:_
{code:xml}
<saml2:AttributeValue>
	<hl7:PurposeOfUse xmlns:hl7="urn:hl7-org:v3" code="TREATMENT" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" displayName="Healthcare Operations"/>
</saml2:AttributeValue>
{code}

*The following excerpt is from the Authorization Framework 3.0 specification and defines the PurposeOfUse with the type of CE:*
{code}
3.2.2.6 Purpose Of Use Attribute
 
This <Attribute> element shall have the Name attribute set to “urn:oasis:names:tc:xspa:1.0:subject:purposeofuse”7. The value of the <AttributeValue> element is a child element, “PurposeOfUse”, in the namespace “urn:hl7-org:v3”,whose content is defined by the “CE” (coded element) data type from the HL7 version 3 specification.
 
The PurposeOfUse element shall contain the coded representation of the reason for the request.
 
An example of the syntax of this element is as follows:
 
Figure 3.3.2.6-1 PurposeOfUse Attribute Example
<saml:Attribute Name="urn:oasis:names:tc:xspa:1.0:subject:purposeofuse">
                <saml:AttributeValue>
                                <PurposeOfUse xmlns="urn:hl7-org:v3" xsi:type="CE" code="OPERATIONS" codeSystem="2.16.840.1.113883.3.18.7.1" codeSystemName="nhin-purpose" displayName="Healthcare Operations"/>
                </saml:AttributeValue>
</saml:Attribute>
{code}
title: SAML Attribute PurposeOfUse missing @type="hl7:CE" declaration

description:
We have the latest CONNECT 4.2.0 release built and deployed within our DIL QA environment on Glassfish 3.1.2.2 using our internal DIL SSL certificates.  This issue is one that we found after our initial build and deployment where we updated the corresponding Merlin Crypto related properties files - "saml.properties", "signature.properties" and "truststore.properties" - in the Glassfish domain "config/nhin" folder with the new certificate alias, password and keystore/truststore file names.  When testing the secured web service endpoints, we observed the following exception in our server log:

{code}
javax.enterprise.system.std.com.sun.enterprise.server.logging|_ThreadID=89;_ThreadName=Thread-2;|rs.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:334)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:166)
        at org.apache.cxf.workqueue.SynchronousExecutor.execute(SynchronousExecutor.java:37)
...
Caused by: org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.CredentialException: Failed to load credentials.
        at org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.Merlin.load(Merlin.java:371)
        at org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.Merlin.loadProperties(Merlin.java:190)
        at org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.Merlin.<init>(Merlin.java:140)
        ... 121 more
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Keystore was tampered with, or password was incorrect
        at sun.security.provider.JavaKeyStore.engineLoad(JavaKeyStore.java:772)
        at sun.security.provider.JavaKeyStore$JKS.engineLoad(JavaKeyStore.java:55)
        at java.security.KeyStore.load(KeyStore.java:1214)
        at org.apache.ws.security.components.crypto.Merlin.load(Merlin.java:365)
        ... 123 more
Caused by: java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException: Password verification failed 
{code}

The issue is that the "Product/Production/Common/Properties" folder is treated as another project during the Maven build process.  This means that a Java library (Properties.jar) is created for the Properties project which contains all of the configuration and properties files that get deployed to the Glassfish domain "config/nhin" folder.  The reason for this is so that the automated testing projects which occur at the end of the Maven build process can execute using the default configuration and properties files settings.  The problem is that this library (Properties.jar) is also then included in the CONNECT EAR and therefore deployed with CONNECT to the application server.  All of these default configuration and properties files within the Properties.jar library and then available on the application's classpath.  Fortunately, all of the configuration XML files are read from the "config/nhin" folder at runtime.  Unfortunately, the Merlin Crypto package classes read their related properties files from the bundled Properties.jar library.  This results in the default certificate alias, password and keystore/truststore file names being used by Merlin.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Investigate the following option -
Properties jar is removed from the Standalone GlassFIsh ear and CI build passes. Validation suite should pass.
Draft Installation instructions on 4.3 wiki page should be updated.
title: Merlin Crypto package classes read their related properties files from the bundled Properties.jar library; not the "config/nhin" folder

description:
CONNECT is not throwing an error when SPProvidedID attribute appears in the Issuer field and the issuer format is entity:

<saml2:Issuer Format="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:entity" SPProvidedID="sp1.test.com">https://www.testingsamlvalidations.com</saml2:Issuer>

NOTE- This test is not included in the participant testing program, but maybe included in the vendor testing in the future
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Snippet from specification -  http://docs.oasis-open.org/security/saml/v2.0/saml-core-2.0-os.pdf
8.3.6 Entity Identifier
URI: urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:entity
Indicates that the content of the element is the identifier of an entity that provides SAML-based services ..............<<full text not included>>
The NameQualifier, SPNameQualifier, and SPProvidedID attributes MUST be omitted.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Test steps for TC: MAQD-R-0003.419 (Handle Issuer Entity Name ID that includes SPProvidedID in Assertion)

The Testing Tool sends a synchronous Find Documents Request to the System, using the following required parameters:
SOAP Header = MP: MA Default Request (TestTool) Message Parameters, **except the 
SOAP header element Security/Assertion/Issuer/@Format = 
"urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:entity" and 
Security/Assertion/Issuer/@SPProvidedID is present.

Expected Result: The System returns a SOAP fault to the Testing Tool with text describing the 
internal error using MP: MA Fault (Both) Message Parameters.
OR
Based on its security policy, instead of returning a fault the System may return a normal response, but without performing the requested action

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

Fix the bug.
Execute the DIL Participant testing test case and ensure that test case passes.
title: Certification Testing: MAQD-R-0003.419 (Handle Issuer Entity Name ID that includes SPProvidedID in Assertion)

description:
HISTORY: 
CONNECT 4.0 includes Direct support as per the specifications for HISP to HISP cases. There is an implementation guide for Delivery notification that discusses scenarios related to notifying users or edge clients of a successful and failed delivery. This ticket is one among a series of tickets to support that capability. Requirements related to this feature and associated specification references and requirements can be found at - https://developer.connectopensource.org/x/AgBVCQ

BUSINESS VALUE: 
Senders are kept informed of whether Direct messages initiated by them have been delivered or not to the final destination and may introduce workflow processes and steps to handle error cases.

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:

With 4.0 the event log database included events tracking the message as it was received from the edge and processed and sent over to the recipient. Also as MDNs(Processed) were received and processed and sent over to the edge these events were logged in the event log database. This information can be used for both metrics and troubleshooting purposes. As new delivery notifications are being introduced, these events need to follow the same paradigm to provide a consistent view to the adopter tracking messages and notifications(both processed and delivery)

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Events related to receiving MDNs for delivery notifications from the remote STA and sending notifications to the edge client should be recorded in the event logs
Events related to sending MDNs for delivery notifications to the remote STA after message has been delivered or not should be logged in the event logs
title: As a CONNECT adopter using Direct, I want all delivery notifications sent or received from the remote STA or the edge to be logged in the CONNECT event logs so that I can troubleshoot and track message delivery

description:
HISTORY: 
CONNECT 4.0 includes Direct support as per the specifications for HISP to HISP cases. There is an implementation guide for Delivery notification that discusses scenarios related to notifying users or edge clients of a successful and failed delivery. This ticket is one among a series of tickets to support that capability. Requirements related to this feature and associated specification references and requirements can be found at - https://developer.connectopensource.org/x/AgBVCQ

BUSINESS VALUE: 
Senders are kept informed of whether Direct messages initiated by them have been delivered or not to the final destination and may introduce workflow processes and steps to handle error cases.

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:

MDN processed messages are intended to be STA to STA notifications to indicate successful receipt and security and trust validation by the receiving STA; delivery of the processed MDN to the sending system is not required to provide assurance that a message has been delivered to its destination.

With the delivery notifications provided to the edge, sending the MDN processed notifications is not necessary.

Based on the flag value, CONNECT will relay the MDN notifications(Processed, Dispatched, Failed) or not relay the MDN notifications to the SMTP edge. Note: this does not impact the success or failure notifications sent back to the edge. CONNECT will create a success or failure notification based on monitoring the incoming MDN notifications and a predefined time interval configured in CONNECT.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
MDN notifications are not sent back to the edge (SOAP or SMTP). SOAP edge already does not forward this MDN to the edge. Introduce a flag in JVM options (and in the glassfish template!) to determine whether or not MDNs should be forwarded to the edge.
Flag has a default value of True
title: As a CONNECT adopter using Direct I do not want to relay MDN notifications back to the edge to avoid redundant notifications and inorder to be spec compliant
Responding Gateway sends "The user is not authorized” error when USER middle name is missing

description:
Enterprise-caliber application servers such as WebSphere and WebLogic often include distributed concepts such as Cells, Nodes, and Servers (for WebSphere) and Admin/Managed servers + clusters (for WebLogic). In these scenarios, security configurations such as certificates and keystores can be configured at Cell or Node levels and may not be available on a server's local file system.

The purpose of this issue is to improve CONNECT handling of these application server configurations for keystores and truststores. This applies to both transport level (SSL) and message level (SAML/XML-Dsig) security.

There are currently 4 overlapping configurations - Inbound SSL (already handled in app server), Outbound SSL and SAML Assertion Signature, and Timestamp Signature.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Complete code/test updates per CONN-340. See CONN-628 and CONN-629 for more details.
Research for all app servers - GlassFish, WL,WAS, JBoss.
title: As a Federal Partner, I want CONNECT to use keystores and truststores configured in my application server, as opposed to file system references, because my application server doesn't always have the local files.

description:
Currently we use javax.net.ssl.* system properties to obtain private/public keys and certificates for signing SAML Assertions. Explore the reuse of these configuration files for creating the SAML assertion signature.

description:
SSLSocketFactories can be obtained by from the application server's SSLContext. I believe we should provide a prioritized system for obtaining the SSLContext. If a protocol and provider are provided via CONNECT configuration (perhaps a system properties), then we can obtain the SSLContext using those parameters, else we can get the default SSLContext.

This approach should be vetted with implementors with the capability to do testing and provide feedback.
title: As a CONNECT implementor, I want to use my application server's SSLSocketFactory for outbound SSL, in order to make my configuration more simple.

description:
Specification references:
IHE ITI TF Rev 7 Vol 2x_2010_08_10 (Page 76) Section V3.2 Requirements for Transactions which don't use HL7 V3 Messages
Table V3.2.1

IHE_WSA101 - All <wsa:Action> elements shall have the mustUnderstand attribute set (mustUnderstand="1")
IHE_WSA102 - The <wsa:ReplyTo> element of the initiating message shall be present and shall have the mustUnderstand attribute set (mustUnderstand="1")

Note in earlier versions of CONNECT, CONNECT populated attribute 'mustUnderstand' value = 'True' for 'action' and 'ReplyTo' elements in the SOAP header in an initiating request, deferred request and a deferred response(Action element), but does not set it in the Synchronous response header(Action element). See post on spec factory for history - http://exchange-specifications.wikispaces.com/share/view/55530026

Requirements
1)Initiator of synchronous requests and deferred (requests and responses)
All <wsa:Action> elements shall have the mustUnderstand attribute set (mustUnderstand="1")
The <wsa:ReplyTo> element of the initiating message shall be present and shall have the mustUnderstand attribute set (mustUnderstand="1")

OPEN QUESTION -- Do we need to do anything on the responding side?

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
WSA:mustUnderstand attribute is being set in all messages as the initiator. (PD,QD,RD,DS and AD)
A regression suite (try for automatic else go for manual) has been added to the "newfeature" directory, and this test must pass.
title: WS-Addressing Header <Action> and <ReplyTo> elements must have the "mustUnderstand" Attribute Set in the initiating message

description:
The CONNECT 4.2.0 release has a dependency on the CONNECT-Webservices-4.0.3 version and the Common-Types-4.0.7 version libraries.  After downloading the source code distributions for both the CONNECT-Webservices-4.0.3 version and the Common-Types-4.0.7 version, I added a new XML schema (xsd) to the Common-Types-4.0.7 project (to support a new service I am writing).  The subsequent build of the Common-Types-4.0.7 projects and deployment of the generated library to my local Maven repository was successful.  I then executed a Maven build on the CONNECT-Webservices-4.0.3 project where I had added a new WSDL file referencing my new XML schema to the Component project.  This failed on the Component project.  I found the cause to be in the "pom.xml" for the CONNECT-Webservices-4.0.3 where the dependency of the Common-Types library was set to "4.0.4":

{code:xml}
<dependencyManagement>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.connectopensource</groupId>
            <artifactId>CONNECTCommonTypesLib</artifactId>
            <version>4.0.4</version>
            <type>jar</type>
        </dependency> 
    </dependencies>
</dependencyManagement>
{code}

description:
CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:

This issue was discovered as part of the NIST validation tool testing with CONNECT 4.1. See forum post ' http://www.connectopensource.org/developer-resources/forums/user-forum#nabble-tc7578884

Per the NwHIN Exchange Authrorization Framework specifications v3.0 Section 3.2.3.1 Authorization Decision Statement Content
Resource. The Resource attribute of the Authorization Decision Statement must be the URI of the endpoint to which the request is addressed or an empty URI reference ("").

Additional research
According to the NwHIN and underlying specifications, it is valid to provide a blank resource value. Opensaml2 seems to have gotten this wrong in terms of validation.

Possible solutions:
1) Continue to use opensaml2 validation but edit the resource before (if it's empty) and null it out again afterwards.
2) Catch the null resource error and ignore it.
3) Write a new validator which skips the resource validation.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
CONNECT should accept the empty URI reference as a valid value for the Resource attribute and not return an error.
A regression suite should be added in NewFeature to test this fix.
title: CONNECT should accept an empty URI reference ("") for the Resource attribute of the the Authorization Decision Statement

description:
HISTORY
NIST tool development/testing team has approached the CONNECT team about some issues they are seeing as they are validating CONNECT using their testing tool. This tool is currently set to validate MU2 users for Sending and receiving CCDA documents using SOAP transport. The NIST testing team has taken the 3.3.1.3  version of CONNECT and is executing tests. They have found a few issues and would like to discuss with the CONNECT team to determine if these are issues and need fixes. 

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL

A list of issues that were brought up are 
 1) With Connect3 sending a request
 
        Connect3 sends ws-addressing tags with this form :
 
            <Action xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing"
                mustUnderstand="true">urn:ihe:iti:2007:ProvideAndRegisterDocumentSet-b
            </Action>
 
The mustUnderstand attribute is rejected by TTT because it must be prefixed by the "http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" namespace
 
From  www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope: 
<!-- Global Attributes.  The following attributes are intended to be usable via qualified attribute names on any complex type referencing them.  -->
<xs:attribute name="mustUnderstand" type="xs:boolean" default="0"/>
 
 
 2) With Connect4 as the responder:
 
Fails because Connect rejects some saml headers. In particular this one :
 
<saml2:AuthzDecisionStatement Decision="Permit"
                    Resource="">
 
When the autorization framework explicitly mentioned this (in red) :
3.3.3.1 Authorization Decision Statement Content 
The Authorization Decision Statement has the following content: 
1.            Action. This action must be specified using a Namespace of 8 'urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:action:rwedc' and a value of Execute. 
2.            Decision. The Decision attribute of the Authorization Decision Statement must be "Permit". 
3.            Resource. The Resource attribute of the Authorization Decision Statement must be the URI of the endpoint to which the request is addressed or an empty URI reference (""). 
 
COMPLETION CRITERIA
Work with the NIST team to identify any issues found related to MU certification of SOAP based transport.
Open Jira tickets for all issues that need fixes or further investigation on 4.x branch
title: As a CONNECT adopter certifying for Meaningful Use Stage 2, I want CONNECT 4.x to pass validation using the NIST tool so that my implementation can be validated for MU

description:
HISTORY:
As part of certification testing for HealtheWay participant and product testing program, CCHIT released 36 security test cases that need to be passed for a product to be certified by the program. 19 of those tests cases are required for participants to onboard successfully to the eHealth Exchange. Details of the test cases are attached.

DETAIL:
6 of the test cases failed when we executed these with the DIL(Developers Integration Lab).
These are - 
TC: MAQD-R-0003.410 Handle Missing Issuer Format in Assertion CONN-543
TC: MAQD-R-0003.411 Handle Invalid Issuer Email Name ID in Assertion  CONN-540
TC: MAQD-R-0003.412 Handle Invalid Issuer X.509 Name ID in Assertion  CONN-541
TC: MAQD-R-0003.413 Handle Invalid Issuer Windows Name ID in Assertion  CONN-542
TC: MAQD-R-0003.421 Handle Missing Subject Name ID in Assertion CONN-537
TC: MAQD-R-0003.422 Handle Invalid Subject Name ID in Assertion CONN-539

Tickets fixing these issues are linked with this ticket.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Create regression test scripts to validate the functionality
title: Create regression test scripts for failed Security test cases related to Issuer and Subject so that these will be included in future release testing going forward.

description:
HISTORY:
One of the test cases TC: MAQD-R-0003.410 (Handle Missing Issuer Format in Assertion) is failing in our tests against the DIL. This used to work in our previous tests, but there have been changes made to these tests to validate the scenario and hence this test is failing. 

DETAIL:
Test steps from documentation provided by CCHIT/HealtheWay

Test Steps

1)The Testing Tool sends a synchronous Find Documents Request to the System, using the following required parameters:
SOAP Header = MP: MA Default Request (TestTool) Message Parameters, **except the SOAP header element Security/Assertion/Issuer/@Format is missing. $XDSDocumentEntryPatientID = [patient P-0000000031] $XDSDocumentEntryStatus = Approved returnType = LeafClass SOAP request = synchronous

2)Expected Result: The System returns a SOAP fault to the Testing Tool with text describing the internal error using MP: MA Fault (Both) Message Parameters.
OR
Based on its security policy, instead of returning a fault the System may return a normal response, but without performing the requested action. Example: if the request were a Patient Discovery, a normal response is returned, but with no matching patients found. This approach of concealing the fault is permitted by the underlying requirements to mitigate certain kinds of attacks.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Test passes.
title: CONNECT fails to send a SOAP fault or normal response without performing requested action when Issuer format is missing in the assertion in the request message(TC 3.410)

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

description:
HISTORY:
One of the test cases TC: MAQD-R-0003.422 (Handle Invalid Subject Name ID in Assertion) is failing in our tests against the DIL. This used to work in our previous tests, but there have been changes made to these tests to validate the scenario and hence this test is failing. 

Email from CCHIT:
That test case (as well as a few of the other ones I have listed below) have a digital re-signer resigning the assertion after the subject name id was removed which I believe is what you're seeing on the second transform.  This isn't a second test case but rather what was needed to be done in order to verify that the gateway was identifying the missing subject name id not the assertion signature being broken.  The AEGIS has taken a look into this test case to verify that the digital re-sginer was indeed needed for this test case and they have confirmed that.  It looks like CXF is not picking the subject name id element missing as an issue is my best guess.

DETAIL:
Test steps from documentation provided by CCHIT/HealtheWay

Test Steps

1)The Testing Tool sends a synchronous Find Documents Request to the System, using the following required parameters:
SOAP Header = MP: MA Default Request (TestTool) Message Parameters, **except the SOAP header element Security/Assertion/Subject/NameID/@Format is something other than the two allowed formats, emailAddress and X509SubjectName. $XDSDocumentEntryPatientID = [patient P-0000000011] $XDSDocumentEntryStatus = Approved returnType = LeafClass SOAP request = synchronous

2)Expected Result: The System returns a SOAP fault to the Testing Tool with text describing the internal error using MP: MA Fault (Both) Message Parameters.
OR
Based on its security policy, instead of returning a fault the System may return a normal response, but without performing the requested action. Example: if the request were a Patient Discovery, a normal response is returned, but with no matching patients found. This approach of concealing the fault is permitted by the underlying requirements to mitigate certain kinds of attacks.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Test passes.
title: CONNECT fails to send a SOAP fault or normal response without performing requested action when Subject Name ID is invalid in the assertion in the request message(TC 3.422)

Email from CCHIT:
That test case (as well as a few of the other ones I have listed below) have a digital re-signer resigning the assertion after the subject name id was removed which I believe is what you're seeing on the second transform.  This isn't a second test case but rather what was needed to be done in order to verify that the gateway was identifying the missing subject name id not the assertion signature being broken.  The AEGIS has taken a look into this test case to verify that the digital re-sginer was indeed needed for this test case and they have confirmed that.  It looks like CXF is not picking the subject name id element missing as an issue is my best guess.

DETAIL:
Test steps from documentation provided by CCHIT/HealtheWay

Test Steps
1. The Testing Tool sends a synchronous Find Documents Request to the System, using the following required parameters:
SOAP Header = MP: MA Default Request (TestTool) Message Parameters, **except the SOAP header element Security/Assertion/Subject/NameID is missing. $XDSDocumentEntryPatientID = [patient P-0000000008] $XDSDocumentEntryStatus = Approved returnType = LeafClass SOAP request = synchronous

Example: if the request were a Patient Discovery, a normal response is returned, but with no matching patients found. This approach of concealing the fault is permitted by the underlying requirements to mitigate certain kinds of attacks.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

description: The event logging database implementation cannot resolve the eventdb_datasource on jboss and therefore fails to log events to the database. A cursory inspection of the code shows that the eventdb_datasource is configured in the jboss-web.xml file - more investigation is warranted.
title: Event Logging database implementation fails with Direct Only on Jboss

description:
urn:oid is a required prefix for the home community ID.

Change 1 - There were many regression tests that were asserting the HCID values and were failing because of the test data in the connection info files and the request. The assertions need to be revisited to make sure that we use string comparisons to evaluate the OID part of the HCID by splitting the prefix(urn:oid) from the actual value. 


Change 2 - Check urn:oid:"hcid" and parse the hcid for UDDI lookup. Also CONNECT to automatically check for the prefix in the incoming request and if it's not available add prefix for the request that it send to Nhin.

COMPLETION CRTIERIA:
Update the test scripts, UDDI connection info, internal connection info, gateway properties files to include urn:oid in the test data.
Ensure that if urn:oid is not present in the entity interface, validate that it is being generated or added by the gateway.
Validate that the string comparisons are working fine through unit tests. 
Ensure that the RD regression tests and validation suite pass.
title: Update regression-validation suite to update string match check for HCIDs or to account for urn:oid prefix being present in the HCID

description:
Doc Retrieve and Doc Submission need to be copied over from ConnectValidationSuite so the base tests function with CONNECT version 4.2. Remote setup script needs to be modified to reflect latest version of gateway.properties.

For Doc Submission:

Make the value that appears in <urn5:Document id="Document01">$value</urn5:Document> be automatically set to the encodedPath value generated when Create Large file is run

For Doc Retrieve, include a setup script take the following snippet of code in documentretrieveproxyconfig.xml:

	<!-- Beans defined: adapterdocumentrepository -->
	
	<alias alias="adapterdocumentrepository" name="adapterdocumentrepositorywsunsecured" />
	
	<!-- No-op Implementation -->
	<bean lazy-init="true" 

class="gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.docrepository.adapter.proxy.AdapterComponentDocRepositoryProxyNoOpImpl" 

id="adapterdocumentrepositorynoop" name="adapterdocumentrepositorynoop">
	    <meta key="impltype" value="noop"/>
	</bean> 

	<!-- Java Implementation -->
	<bean lazy-init="true" 

class="gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.docrepository.adapter.proxy.AdapterComponentDocRepositoryProxyJavaImpl" 

id="adapterdocumentrepositoryjava" name="adapterdocumentrepositoryjava"> 
		<meta key="impltype" value="java"/>
	</bean>
	
	<!-- Bean Implementation -->
	<bean lazy-init="true" 

class="gov.hhs.fha.nhinc.docrepository.adapter.proxy.AdapterComponentDocRepositoryProxyBeanImpl" 

id="adapterdocumentrepositorybean" name="adapterdocumentrepositorybean"> 
		<property name="homeCommunityId" value="urn:oid:2.2" />
		<property name="repositoryUniqueId" value="1" />
		<property name="documentUniqueId" value="1.123407.777777" />
		<property name="mimeType" value="text/xml" />
		<property name="document" value="ZmlsZTovLy9Vc2Vycy9ha29uZy9wYXlsb2Fkcy8xRy56aXA=" />
	</bean> 


and does the following:

change 

<alias alias="adapterdocumentrepository" name="adapterdocumentrepositorywsunsecured" />

to

<alias alias="adapterdocumentrepository" name="adapterdocumentrepositorybean" />

set

<property name="document" value="ZmlsZTovLy9Vc2Vycy9ha29uZy9wYXlsb2Fkcy8xRy56aXA=" />

to the encodedpath value generated when running Create Large File


Running remote setup script seems to corrupt gateway.properties file. One thing noticed is it removes all the lines needed for passthrough mode.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Large payload testing is updated in  regression testing suite and included in release artifacts
title: Update Large Payload regression suite

description:
This is a forum post that we received 

CVE-2013-2172 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-2172) describes an XML Spoofing Vulnerability in Apache Santuario. 

Connect contains an embedded copy of Apache Santuario which is subject to the following security advisory http://santuario.apache.org/secadv.data/CVE-2013-2172.txt.asc. Can we please update xmlsec to the 1.5.5 version as suggested in the advisory. 

Currently Connect 4.1 ships with xmlsec-1.5.3.jar which is part of the applications lib directory. 


COMPLETION CRITERIA:
DEV - Investigate the link provided and make updates to use the jar to fix the vulnerability.
QA - needs to use the new 4.2 build and re-run all 2011 participant testing test cases to ensure that the fix does not break any of the security testing results.(See attached document for test cases that need to be executed - There are 36 test cases to be re-run out of which 19 should be executed first(ones for participant testing))
All 36 DIL test cases need to passs
Also open the CONNECT ear via a zip program (7zip, winzip, etc) and ensure that xmlsec-1.5.5.jar is present (not xmlsec-1.5.3.jar).
title: Update xmlsec jar in CONNECT 4.2 to fix XML Spoofing Vulnerability in Apache Santuario

description:
Currently we have a regression suite GATEWAY-2085 that is failing. This relates to a test that is validating the PD response when Policy engine returns a Deny to the responding gateway. Currently the gateway is returning different result that the expected result.  It seems that the test suite expects a particular error response for no patients returned  but CONNECT is sending an error response related to policy check failure.  We need to check out why there is this discrepancy and assess if any changes are needed to be made to the script.
It seems that a change was made as part of GATEWAY-1998 somewhere in 3.3, and we are not sure if the script has captured the essence of the requirement, some more investigation is needed.

On another note, recently there was a discussion in the spec factory related to - Allowable responses in fault or access denial conditions. I am attaching the copy of the document that I have that talks about how a gateway should address policy check scenarios(C-5 and C-6). 
It is not clear at this point whether CONNECT is compliant with these use cases and for all services. However in here it says - if the entire req is denied, it can be a soap fault, or transaction specific error or normal empty response. If partial deny then it should send a normal partial response.  These access policy check scenarios are not being tested as part of the certification test program for now. 

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Document CONNECT behavior in the case of policy check failure for all services at the initiating and responding side.
title: Investigate and research  code related to GATEWAY-2085 regression suite

description:
HISTORY:

The smoke tests have been updated for QD, to include Status and DocumentEntryType in the request. We need to support these in our QD reference adapters.
<<ADD THE SMOKE TEST NAME >>
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryStatus">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>
('urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:StatusType:Approved','urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:StatusType:Deprecated')
</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryType">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>('urn:uuid:34268e47-fdf5-41a6-ba33-82133c465248')</ns4:Value>
<ns4:Value>('urn:uuid:7edca82f-054d-47f2-a032-9b2a5b5186c1')</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>

DETAIL:
DocumentEntryType is not valid for 2010 messages and was introduced in 2011 specifications.
Filter documents based on multiple status values in the query request. (E.g. Status of Approved or Deprecated)
Filter documents based on multiple Document entry types in the query request(E.g. DocumentEntryType of Stable or OnDemand)

Requests could include status of Approved or Deprecated or both. If Approved only or Deprecated only - only those specific status documents should be returned. If both status values are included in the same slot(OR condition) then you need to return documents that are Approved or Deprecated.

Requests could include DocumentEntryType of Stable or OnDemand. 
If Stable only or OnDemand only - only those specific documents should be returned that have the appropriate DocumentEntryType. If both status values are included in the same slot(OR condition) then you need to return documents that are Stable or OnDemand. NOTE THIS IS ONLY APPLICABLE FOR 2011. SEE OPEN QUESTION BELOW

OPEN QUESTION TO CCHIT : Is this smoke test case being utilized for 2010 participant testing also? or only 2011...assuming 2011 since DOcumentEntryType is not valid for 2010. What is the expectation /expected result if 2010 endpoint receives this request, or how are smoke tests altered for 2010 participants?

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
To be determined

UPDATE 08/07/2013:  No need to do anything for XDSDocumentEntryType. Our adapter DOES use this parameter when processing Document Queries, we just need to set the OnDemand value to "1" (in docrepository.documents) to make it an on-demand document.
title: Upgrade QD adapter to support filtering of documents based on Status and DocumentEntryType parameters in the request

description:
HISTORY:
Security and code quality scans are run periodically especially at release time on every CONNECT release and the reports are analyzed by the team. a
The team needs to review the report, respond and address pertinent findings. 
The first step will develop a plan to analyze the information that has been provided - Identify which of these are real production impacting security risks. As well as code quality related issues that we consider important to be fixed.  The second step will be to develop a plan to address the findings that must be addressed and provide rationale for the findings that do not need to be addressed.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
Information will be documented in the wiki for every release.
This epic will store contain all the findings tickets across all releases. A user story needs to be created for every release that addresses the findings for that release.

BUSINESS VALUE:
Helps community and product team better understand results of the scan.
Help prioritize and plan to address any high priority or critical issues.
Allows adopters to meet their internal organizations reviews and deploy the application.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Scans are reviewed and discussed with product team. Team has a better understanding of the scan results.
Identification of critical issues and plan to address and written rationale for the findings that do not need to be addressed.
title: As a CONNECT adopter/product owner, I want the report for the security scan reviewed, responded to and issues addressed so that I can better understand the security issues associated with the CONNECT code and prepare for internal reviews

description:
Discovered during CCHIT certificate validation from DIL Lab Portal:
SS: PRL-0005.0>TS: PRL-R-0008.0>TC:QD-R-3146.0 (This is the simplest test case we considered to reproduce the issue and there are several other test cases related to eventCodeList).

The request message contains:
For QD-R-3146.0, if you look in the test case documentation, you'll see that only one document should be returned.  The reason for this is the way the test case Request is sent.  The event codes in the Request is displayed as:
(T-32000 OR T-32001) 
And should be handled for any documents with the following codes:
T-32000 or T-32001

If you would like to see more details in the specs around this, you can find those details here:
IHE ITI TF-2a: section 3.18.4.1.2.3.5

Response:
If you configure database eventcode table to have only T-32000 and ignore T-32001, the response returns no documents found. The reason is due to a bug in the code the order it is parsing the eventcode list, it will always have only one last row and all the other codes get overridden because the variable is always initialized inside the for loop and slot value extracted is added to it.
title: Extract slots always gets one last value from the slots list (Adapter)

description:
DIL submits QD request to system under test with the following parameters and no documents are being returned:

<S:Body>
<ns3:AdhocQueryRequest xmlns:ns2="urn:gov:hhs:fha:nhinc:gateway:samltokendata" xmlns:ns3="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:query:3.0" xmlns:ns4="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:rim:3.0" xmlns:ns5="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:rs:3.0" xmlns:ns6="urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:xsd:lcm:3.0" startIndex="0" maxResults="-1">
<ns3:ResponseOption returnType="LeafClass" returnComposedObjects="true"/>
<ns4:AdhocQuery id="urn:uuid:14d4debf-8f97-4251-9a74-a90016b0af0d" home="urn:oid:209.251.180.228.0">
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryPatientId">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>'alpha47^^^&209.251.180.228.0&ISO'</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryStatus">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>
('urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:StatusType:Approved')
</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryEventCodeList">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>('T-32000^^SNM3')</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>
<ns4:Slot name="$XDSDocumentEntryEventCodeList">
<ns4:ValueList>
<ns4:Value>('T-32001^^SNM3')</ns4:Value>
</ns4:ValueList>
</ns4:Slot>
</ns4:AdhocQuery>
</ns3:AdhocQueryRequest>
</S:Body>


Full request message and server log attached

Adapter apparently does filter by one or more of those parameters listed and does not return any docs that do not match the values. Also, sometimes a slot can have more than one value and adapter does not seem to break them down into separate values but, rather, tries to match the entire string:

<ns4:Value>
('urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:StatusType:Approved','urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-regrep:StatusType:Deprecated')
</ns4:Value>

COMPLETION CRITERIA :

- Upgrade adapter to filter documents based on these new fields
- Upgrade adapter to recognize multiple values in one slot
- Validate scenarios for OR, AND or OR and AND.(see attached spec references for details)
- Create regression suite to support the scenarios
- Run DIL test SS: PRL-0005.0>TS: PRL-R-0008.0>TC: QD-R-3019.0 to verify results
title: Adapter QD upgrade - Update QD adapter to support requests with multiple event codes.

description:
Bugs fixed and other improvements in this release are

CONN-438 - CONNECT not populating WSA:To value in NwHIN interfaces
CONN-408 - MTOM Service Decorator is set for all web service requests; causing interoperability failure against other gateway types 
CONN-420 - Direct is failing in WebSphere 8.5/7.0 if databaseEventLogger is enabled 
CONN-402 - Empty relatesToList value on the Entity interfaces results in an empty but existent wsa:RelatesTo header 
CONN-401 - CONNECT no longer throws exception if empty RelatesTo element is present in QD request 
CONN-400 - Update PD adapter to populate CountryCode in PD response if present in mpi file 
CONN-478 - Update QD adapter to support requests with multiple event codes.(regression updated included in this ticket)

Note - Regression suite has been updated for CONN-408 as part of CONN-422

COMPLETION CRITERIA:

description:
BUSINESS VALUE:
- Facilitates quicker adoption as adopters are not required to understand the complex underlying specifications.
- CONNECT integration with EHR systems is simple and easy.

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:

CONNECT implements reference adapter implementations for the various services that allow for provider systems or clients to talk to CONNECT both at the initiating side and the responding side. These implementations require that adopters understand and implement the Nationwide Health Information Network 
specifications (NwHIN) as well as the underlying specifications. As an example , the Patient Discovery(PD) entity interface that an EHR system could use to initiate a PD request to the eHealth Exchange, expects a PD request message (except for the SAML headers) to be sent to CONNECT. CONNECT takes the PD request message and uses the assertion (input parameter to the interface), to create and populate the SAML headers that are required, creating a NwHIN compliant PD request message. Creating these PD request messages to be sent to CONNECT and then parsing the responses from CONNECT is a pretty daunting task and there have been requests or discussion around how to simplify this integration. Would a simple interface that is easy to use, that would only take a few parameters that are required for the service e.g. 'Name','DOB', 'Gender' etc. and the assertion parameter suffice? The goal would be to  identify the minimum set of parameters needed for both the service request and the response, that would enable CONNECT to properly create a compliant NwHIN message and then transform the response to a form that could be utilized easily by the adapter's interface. Bulk of the work related to message creation per NwHIN spec requirements, interpretation of the specifications and parsing the message response be transferred to CONNECT is what is needed. 

Scope Includes:

Scope Excludes:

Assumptions:

Constraints:

Non functional requirements:




ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

To be determined.....

description:
HISTORY:
After standing up CONNECT 4.1 as a test participant gateway in the Developers Integration Lab (DIL), initial testing of a Patient Discovery request from CONNECT 4.1 to CONNECT 3.3.x failed due to the CONNECT 4.1 PD request web service message having its content type set with MTOM enabled --> "Content-Type: multipart/related;".

Examination of the CONNECT 4.1 base logic used to configure the ServiceEndPoint port found that the MTOMServiceEndpointDecorator was being set without any conditional logic.  This results in a majority, if not all, outbound web service requests from CONNECT 4.1 having MTOM enabled.

This is inconsistent with prior versions of CONNECT and other NwHIN compliant gateways.

The attached server log from CONNECT 4.1 shows the Patient Discovery outbound request message with the MTOM / multipart content type as well as the subsequent SOAP Fault from the responding CONNECT 3.3.x gateway followed by the exception trace content.

ADDITIONAL BACKGROUND
After clarification with CCHIT/ Aegis Testing Team they provided the following summary:
"They feel it's a spec issue at this point. CONNECT 4.1 is sending PD requests using MTOM/XOP format. Richard was able to confirm that some of our infrastructure can consume that format, and it may well be that it's common in web service stacks to accept both plain vanilla SOAP and XOP formats, but we believe the specs are clear that it is not supposed to be used on PD and QD endpoints.

I've written a Spec Factory question about this: http://exchange-specifications.wikispaces.com/share/view/622628"


COMPLETION CRITERIA

We met with the testing team on 5/7/13 and will make sure CONNECT follows the following spec compliant behavior:
PD and PD Deferred - Simple SOAP
QD - Simple SOAP
RD - MTOM/XOP
DS and DS Deferred- MTOM/XOP
AD- MTOM/XOP
title: DIL Testing - MTOM Service Decorator is set for all web service requests; causing interoperability failure against other gateway types

description:
The Domain xml template files provided under the <Connect_install>/glassfish_templates directory are very different from one another.  The [installation instructions |https://developer.connectopensource.org/display/CONNECT40/Deploying+CONNECT+4.1+from+Binaries] simply instruct you to use the self-signed template without mentioning the other templates.

In one installation attempt I used the 64bit template file and found that it needed to be modified in a number of ways before I could get Connect running:

* Under configs/config[@name='server-config']/java-config , had to add: <jvm-options>-Xmx3072m</jvm-options> or glassfish would crash with 'out of memory'
* Added all the required datasources manually

At this stage, the validation test suite was still failing (didn't keep track of exactly why, sorry), so I moved to using the self-signed domain.xml template which worked off the bat.

So my questions are:  Is there a purpose for the template files that aren't mentioned in the above instructions?  The self-signed template would need to specify a keystore with a self-signed certificate but other than this, is there anything that makes this template specific to a self-signed scenario?
title: Vast differences between Domain.xml templates

description:
Per the NhincCommon schema the relatesToList element is unbounded but does not contain a minOccurs=0, therefore it is "required" per the schema. In a scenario where the WSA RelatesTo header is not required on the Nhin message (read: all scenarios except for deferred), an examination of the schema might lead to adopters providing an empty relatesToList value. This can lead to CONNECT producing nonconformant Nhin messages.

This issue will be fixed in the 4.X code line, see the work around and resolution details sections for more details.

CC:
Update the relatesToList element to be optional (minOccurs="0"), and ensure that if a blank (null, empty, or whitespace) relatesTo value is provided, that it does not result in an empty WSA:RelatesTo value on the Nhin message. Include unit tests.
title: Empty relatesToList value on the Entity interfaces results in an empty but existent wsa:RelatesTo header

description: When testing the QD response smoke test, CONNECT throws a null pointer exception. The reason for this is that an empty 'RelatesTo' tag is present in the QD request message.

description:
HISTORY:
The NwHIN Exchange has transitioned from an ONC federal program initiative to a public-private initiative called eHealth Exchange. The Coordinating Committee designated Healtheway, a non-profit organization, to support the eHealth Exchange. HealtheWay assumed operation and support for the eHealth Exchange, starting 10/1/12 including Testing and onboarding. The new Testing team (CCHIT along with Aegis) has published test scripts that will be used for testing and onboarding participants into the Exchange.<NEED TO ADD DETAIL ABT THE PRODUCT TESTING VS IMPLEMENTATION TESTING , WHAT CERTIFICATION ARE WE GOING FOR> 

BUSINESS VALUE:
Adopters can participate in eHealth Exchange for PD, QD,RD,DS and AD services using a product that is certified by eHealth Exchange.
Using an Exchange Ready System implies minimum or no risk to the adopters participating in Exchange.

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:
-Identify gaps in the CONNECT product (Release 4.X) for PD, QD, RD, DS and AD services and the functionality as defined in the  test scripts published by CCHIT/Aegis. 
-Publish list of gaps
-Prioritize gaps and fix
-Test CONNECT and validate it is Exchange Ready for PD,QD,RD,AD,DS,Direct services.(2011 version of messages will be tested)

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
CONNECT is a certified Exchange ready system certified for PD,QD,RD,AD,DS services
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I need CONNECT 3.3 to be Exchange ready and certified by the eHealth Exchange certification body (CCHIT) so that I can use a certified product for health data exchange

description:
HISTORY:
FIPS 140-2 is a government standard that provides a benchmark on how to implement cryptographic software. In CONNECT 4.0, CONNECT supported multiple application servers like WebSphere, WebLogic and GlassFish. We have assumed that WebSphere and WebLogic natively support FIPS, but we need to complete an analysis and testing effort to understand the configuration under which this can be achieved. There has been some work done on this during the 4.0 release, where the product team worked with the federal partners on (GATEWAY-3065). However, that work was not completed. This ticket is to address this issue and complete necessary work required to be FIPS compliant for WebLogic.

BUSINESS VALUE:
Federal partners can deploy CONNECT in their environments.

CONSIDERATIONS/DETAIL:
Do we need to work with the federal partners on this?  Which partners, resources and/or teams?  Other specifics of the task will need to be determined.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Installation instructions are uploaded to the wiki for WebLogic 11g.

PRE-REQUISITES:
1) Product Team needs to procure or needs access to a WebLogic 11g environment. As of April 2013, we have this pre-requisite satisfied.

See CONN-30 for the corresponding WebSphere ticket.
title: As a CONNECT adopter I want installation instructions on how to configure and deploy CONNECT 4.x to be FIPS 140-2 compliant on a WebLogic 11g app server so that I can install CONNECT in my secure environment

description:
HISTORY: This issue was discussed during the Exchange Spec factory call on 4/25/2013 where Epic implementations use X.509 certs instead of RSAKeyValues. RSAKeyValue is required to be used as identified in the Auth framework specs(v3.0) Section 3.2.4.3. CONNECT uses RSAKeyValues. Also, CONNECT implementations in the Exchange are able to accept(responder) and process the X509 certs as well. Epic failed a couple of the MA test cases during pilot testing and were hoping that X509 certs be allowed since they are richer, and can provide more information if needed.

See forum post for details - http://exchange-specifications.wikispaces.com/share/view/62085530

CP is being drafted by the spec factory.

See related ticket CONN-735

DETAIL:
Provide users the options to either use RSAKeyValue or X509certs. Make it configurable at the initiator. No changes needed for responder

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
TBD
title: As a CONNECT user, I want CONNECT to support X509 certificates to identify the subject so that I could use X509 certs instead of RSAKeyValue in my implementation

description:
{{FileUtils-*.jar}} file is required for successful running of the SOAP UI Validation Suite for CONNECT, however, it's *not* provided as part of binary distribution. The only way how to get hold of this file currently is to compile it from source manually, which is quite pain as it makes whole workflow for validation of CONNECT installation much more time consuming.
There was already a ticket for the same work (GATEWAY-2690) but although it has been fixed and closed, the {{FileUtils-*.jar}} file is still missing from binary files.
title: Please provide the FileUtils-*.jar file as part of binary installation
Test CONNECT on RedHat Linux with WL 11g with Java JDK 1.6.
Test CONNECT on Solaris with WL 11g with Java JDK 1.6.

description:
HISTORY: CONNECT 4.0 includes support for the Direct Project's Applicability Statement for Secure Health Transport. 

The Applicability Statement specifies that Security/Trust Agents (STAs) MUST issue a Message Disposition Notification (MDN, RFC3798) with a disposition of processed upon successful receipt, decryption, and trust validation of a Direct message. By sending this MDN, the receiving STA is taking custodianship of the message and is indicating that it will deliver the message to its destination. While the Applicability Statement indicates that additional MDNs may be sent to indicate further processing progress of the message, they are not required. The Applicability Statement also does not provide guidance in regards to the actions that should be taken by the sending STA in the event an MDN processed message is not received or if the receiving STA cannot deliver the message to its destination after sending the initial MDN processed message. Due to the lack of specifications and guidance in the Applicability Statement regarding deviations from normal message flow, STAs utilizing CONNECT implementing only requirements denoted as MUST in Section 3 of the Applicability Statement cannot provide a high level of assurance that a message has arrived at its destination. 
There is an implementation guide for Delivery notification that discusses scenarios related to notifying users or edge clients of a successful and failed delivery.

CONNECT 4 uses the Java Reference Implementation components as dependencies in 4.0. The Java Reference Implementation has been updated recently to include other features like support for trust bundles and quality of service delivery notifications mentioned above. These need to be incorporated into CONNECT.


CONSIDERATION/DETAIL:
The goal of this feature (EPIC – Direct Enhancements – CONN-381) is to evaluate the updated Java RI and leverage the associated components/code into CONNECT code base so that CONNECT adopters will be able to provide and receive delivery notifications for Direct messages as well as will have the ability to configure trust bundles to support scalability and improved workflow.

For details on the requirements related to this feature see https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/x/lwGD

BUSINESS VALUE:
Provide adopters high level of assurance that a Direct message has arrived at its destination.
Senders are kept informed of failed delivery and may introduce workflow processes and further processing/steps to handle error cases.
Support trust communities implementing trust bundles. 
Reduce overhead for the HISP implementers utilizing CONNECT with regards to setting up anchors and bundles at the HISP

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
CONNECT supports usage and configuration of trust bundles. (CONN-184, CONN-194)
CONNECT supports positive and negative delivery notifications.(CONN-198, CONN-199, CONN-200,CONN-633, CONN-202, CONN-201, CONN-203, CONN-635, CONN-204, CONN-205, CONN-206)
Functional and non'functional requirements described in https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/x/lwGD are met
title: As a CONNECT adopter using Direct transport, I want CONNECT to be kept up to date with the Direct Reference Implementation and Direct Implementation guides so that the community can make use of success/failure delivery notifications and trust bundles

description:
HISTORY: See CONN-46 for the feature requested.  This user story supports the feature request for the Retrieve Documents(RD) service

BUSINESS VALUE: 
-Support implementers that have strict validation procedures required at the adapter. 
-Adopters do not have to write logic to determine the message specification version in their adapters, minimizing overhead.
-Determining the message spec version and passing it off to the adapter provides a consistent approach for adopters, so that we do not have one-off rules or logic being implemented in the community(adapters)to determine what spec version is being implemented.

LISTED BELOW ARE ALL THE SCENARIOS THAT NEED TO BE TESTED.

SCENARIO 1 - g0 and g1, a0 and a1 adapter

Responding gateway B supports RD 2010 and 2011 specs.
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints - 2.0(2010) and 3.0(2011) and adapter endpoints - a0 and a1 endpoints. 
CASE 1
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 2.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B routes the message to a0 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode). ).  implSpecVersion parameter in the interface is set to 2.0
 
CASE 2
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 3.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B routes the message to the a1 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode). ).  implSpecVersion parameter in the interface is set to 3.0
SCENARIO 2 - g0 and g1, a0 adapter only
Responding gateway is set up to receive all RD messages on one adapter endpoint only
Responding gateway B supports RD 2010 and 2011 specs. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 2.0(2010) and 3.0(2011) and adapter endpoint - a0 endpoint only. 
CASE 1
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 2.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (2.0) to the a0 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode). 
CASE 2
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 3.0 endpoint
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (3.0) to the a0 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).
( Note - This adapter level a0 does not support the 3.0 spec parameters for on demand documents,so it does not make sense for implementers to use a0 API level to receive g1 messages in this case for RD.)

SCENARIO 3 - g0 and g1, a1 adapter only
Responding gateway is set up to receive all RD messages on one adapter endpoint only
Responding gateway B supports RD 2010 and 2011 specs. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 2.0(2010) and 3.0(2011) and adapter endpoint - a1 endpoint only.
CASE 1
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 2.0 endpoint.
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (2.0) to the a1 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode). 
CASE 2
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 3.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (3.0) to the a1 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).

SCENARIO 4 - g0, a0 adapter only

Responding gateway B supports RD 2010 specs only. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 2.0(2010) and adapter endpoint - a0 endpoint only.
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 2.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (2.0) to the a0 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).
SCENARIO 5 - g0, a1 adapter only

Responding gateway B supports RD 2010 specs only. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 2.0(2010) and adapter endpoint - a1 endpoint only.
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 2.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (2.0) to the a1 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).

SCENARIO 6 - g1, a1 adapter only

Responding gateway B supports RD 2011 specs only. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 3.0(2011) and adapter endpoint - a1 endpoint only.
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 3.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (3.0) to the a1 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).

SCENARIO 7 - g1, a0 adapter only

Responding gateway B supports RD 2011 specs only. 
Gateway B configured with gateway endpoints- 3.0(2011) and adapter endpoint - a1 endpoint only.
• Gateway B receives an RD request on the 3.0 endpoint. 
• Gateway B passes the message and implSpecVersion (3.0) to the a0 adapter (in standard and pass-through mode).
( Note - This adapter level does not support the 3.0 spec parameters for on demand documents,so it does not make sense for implementers to use a a0 API level to receive g1 messages in this case for RD.)


COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Test all the scenarios in standard and pass-through modes for RD. 
Update test scripts to include testing for this functionality. 
Design updated with any additional information and/or implementation guidance.
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want to know the service version of the inbound RD request, so that I can determine how to validate/process the request and generate the appropriate response.

Initiating gateway receives a request message from QD a1 entity endpoint in passthrough mode.
Case 1
-	useSpecVersion is None
-	Available target community supports 3.0 spec version
Initiating gateway sends the QD request message over to the Responding gateway' on the 3.0 endpoint.
Case 2
-	useSpecVersion is 2010
-	Available target community supports only 3.0 spec version
Initiating gateway sends the QD response message over to the entity interface indicating 'No matching target'
Case 3
-	useSpecVersion is 2011
-	Available target community supports 3.0 spec version
Initiating gateway sends the QD request message over to the Responding gateway' on the 3.0 endpoint.

Fan-out scenarios are not in scope for this ticket.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
 
Test all the scenarios in standard and pass-through modes for QD. 
Update test scripts to include testing for this functionality. 
Design updated with any additional information and/or implementation guidance.
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want to instruct the gateway which spec version/endpoint  to target for QD service so that I have greater flexibility when exchanging with my trading partners.

REMINDER:  GlassFish 3.x does not support the NSS libraries, as of April 2013.

description:
Enterprise-caliber application servers such as WebSphere and WebLogic often include distributed concepts such as Cells, Nodes, and Servers (for WebSphere) and Admin/Managed servers + clusters (for WebLogic). In these scenarios, security configurations such as certificates and keystores can be configured at Cell or Node levels and may not be available on a server's local file system.

The purpose of this issue is to investigate whether we can get a handle to these application server configurations for keystores and truststores in CONNECT. This applies to both transport level (SSL) and message level (SAML/XML-Dsig) security.

There are 3 configurations - Inbound SSL (already handled in app server), Outbound SSL and SAML(file permissions can handle to some extent)

Scope of this ticket is to handle only Outbound SSL.

COMPLETION CRITERIA:
Research for all app servers - GlassFish, WL,WAS, JBoss.

description:
All of our application server installation instructions contain references to putting the keystore and truststore on the server's classpath. Update each of these application server installation instructions to provide a second option.

The keystore and truststore configured for the saml assertion (saml.properties, signature.properties, and truststore.properties) in the default configuration contain references to gateway.jks, and cacerts.jks. When these files are referenced without any path, CXF looks for them on the classpath - therefore requiring that the store be on the classpath. However these files can be updated to provide an absolute path which no longer requires the stores to be on the class path.

Update each application install instructions to contain this information. Something like "place the gateway and cacerts.jks files on the server classpath, or update these files to contain absolute paths.", but clean up the language and reuse whatever exists in the install instructions.
title: Update 4.x installation instructions to provide move clarity around putting keystores and truststores on the classpath.

description:
Create a child page here: https://developer.connectopensource.org/display/CONNECT40/Installation+Options and list it under "supplemental instructions". Call it something like "Explanation of Certificate Configuration". Clean up the language below and provide examples.

The content of the page needs to explain the following:
1) Configuring Certificates in the Application Server - These are the certificates used by the application server when receiving a request the is secured by SSL. CONNECT uses these configurations when receiving and responding to secured messages. Reference how these certs are configured in each app server (GF - http listeners, WAS/WASCE/WebLogic - admin console, etc).
2) System properties (sometimes also configured in the admin consoles) - The system properties (-Djavax.ssl., etc) are used by CONNECT when initiating an SSL request. These configurations are used when CONNECT is sending a secured request. In general, these certs should be the same as the ones configured in part 1.
3) saml.properties, signature.properties, and truststore.properties - these files are used by CONNECT to sign the saml assertion. These files can be but do not necessarily have to be the same keystore and truststore as used for SSL.

Lastly provide a link back to this new created page in each of the application server's installation instructions from the certificate configuration section.
title: Create a wiki page in the install instructions space that explains each certificate configuration.

description:
This ticket is to update 4.0 and 4.1 install instructions so that it's more clear how to configure certificates in CONNECT. There are two fundamental areas which require more information (represented as subtasks):
1) CONNECT requires certificates to be configured in three different places. We need to explain how each of those configurations are used.
2) Specific to the SAML certificate configuration files, we express in the install instructions that the keystore/truststore used for saml configuration must be on the classpath - this is not necessarily true and we should clarify.
title: As a CONNECT adopter, I want to understand how certificates are configured in CONNECT, so that I can configure them correctly in my environment.

description:
HISTORY: Requested by SSA/CMS-esMD. 

SSA - Databases are not allowed in the zones where CONNECT is deployed. Additionally, through the use of passthrough mode, noop auditing, and log4j event logging, SSA does not use databases with CONNECT at all.
Transaction logging in CONNECT 4.X requires the use of database at the gateway and SSA would like other options explored instead of using database. Some options on the table for correlating deferred responses are an "in memory" mapping between transaction id - message id - relatesto, as well as a file based mapping.
CMS - Presentation layer at CMS does not allow (have) any databases (no my SQL, Oracle) to be housed in the presentation layer, only contains gateway EAR/application files. CMS uses CONNECT adapters that talk to the esMD database layer where database files can be stored. Currently CMS is seeing an issue/error since the transaction database is being accessed by the gateway. CMS would like the ability to disable database configuration options in 4.2

BUSINESS VALUE:
Support federal partners as they deploy CONNECT in their preferred environments that cannot have databases at the gateway tier.

CONSIDERATION/DETAIL: 
Details of requirements and design approach can found at
- https://connectopensource.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CONNECTWIKI/Database-less+transaction+logging


COMPLETION CRITERIA:
1) Create a proxy interface complete with proxy factory/spring xml.
2) Refactor current implementation (database) to the interface.
3) Create Noop implementation.
4) Create in memory (java.util.map) based implementation.
5) Create new feature tests cases.
title: As a Federal Partner, I want a database-less implementation of transaction logging, so that I can deploy CONNECT 4.x without a database at the gateway.
